Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: J.Frazier
review_detail.title: TCL - Best bang for your buck
review_detail.content: I've never heard of TCL before I purchased this TV, when I asked people I knew who were TV fanatics they all seemed fair to midland on the quality.  I needed a new bedroom TV that had smart functions such as hulu and Netflix, and Playstation Vue, so having roku built in was going to be very convenient.  The setup was easy, just attach the legs to the bottom of the TV with 2 screws each.  It is a bit wobbly if pushed, but it seems sturdy enough.  Setting up the TV itself was fast, it does ask you to connect or setup your Roku account, which took just a few mins.  It will even ask you to plug in your existing equipment (cable box, game systems, amazon fire tv, etc) into the HDMI ports and allow you to tell it what each hdmi port has connected.

Have been watching football all day and it's been a pleasure. Played FIFA on my PS4 earlier in the day and it looked and performed great.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Sami N
review_detail.title: Wonderful TV!
review_detail.content: This is a wonderful TV. The first one that came had a cracked screen and Amazon replaced it immediately! (thanks!). This TV (55") is really huge and the picture quality in my honest opinion is very clear. Please note if you use cable, I noticed yesterday when trying the cable channels, almost all the channels are HD 1080. So you may not see any difference in the picture quality (except that the screen might be much larger) in the cable channels (e.g., CNNHD). But, there are many movies and also Youtube clips that are in 4K and you can really enjoy them. What I noticed is that even 1080 provides a good quality for my eyes. I could hardly notice if a picture is 1080 or 4K, but I can tell you the 4K quality seemed just to be very real. Given the largeness of the screen, you could think you were there in person (something you can't possibly feel with 1080). The Ruko environment is wonderfully easy (I already had a Roku account from the past). For its price, I think this TV is a bargain. Overall, my previous TV (LG 42" 3D HD) was already really good so I was in doubt whether paying an extra $400+ (price and tax) would justify, but now I can see it was worth. It's like having a small-scale movie theatre in your home. Lastly, I read among the reviews (before buying the TV) that some people had complained about the TV's speaker (so I had thought I needed also to buy a separate speaker!). Honestly, I find the speakers really awesome! I don't know what these other reviewers are talking about. I agree it is not the best speaker you may see, but I find the sound quality and volume to be really good (note: I am only an ordinary use, not a tech savvy who can distinguish microscopic differences). Overall, if you are looking for a 4K TV and not very expensive, I strongly recommend that look at this TV very closely before considering anything else. I have found it a really good TV.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.content: we love this Smart TV!!!

review_detail.author: R. Brooding
review_detail.title: Pro Tip: Get the Insurance
review_detail.content: We ordered this television and got it at a great price. When we received it, the interface (Roku) was user friendly as was the remote (the kids loved it). The picture quality was not as nice as we initially hoped (watched Moana in HD) but between the user-friendly UI, the decent quality picture and great price, we decided to keep it. Over two weeks of use, we had 3-4 complete television freezes, resulting in several resets. Again, no big deal. What ruined this television for us was the loud pop from the television one day, seems like it broke and would not come on. We contacted Amazon and ended up returning the television, electing to go with another brand. It's a shame, we wanted to like the TV but it just did not work for us. We also recognize this can happen to any electronic device.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Darcie Mullins
review_detail.title: ***Update*** I've had for 6 months now...
review_detail.content: ***Update*** - It's now been 6 months, and the TV will no longer turn on!  Contacting and going through their Warranty procedure is an absolute nightmare!  Once you call, and they do nothing but make you unplug your TV, and try to reset it, you email them your life history, and get an automated response of - 1-2 business day response time.  Well, it's now been over a week with no response, and still a broken TV that just has a blue screen when turned on. When I sent a follow up email they said they still didn't have enough information, but no one of course told me this upfront (again, they want your blood in writing). So, I get another automated response today of - 1-2 day response time.  You get what you pay for - 6 months of an amazing TV (seriously loved it), and then nothing!  Warranty through them is useless, and they are less than helpful.  Over a week with no TV/Cable now - it's irritating when you want to watch a movie or news, but can't!

review_detail.author: Cliff Weed
review_detail.title: TV is fine, delivery is questionable.
review_detail.content: It actually makes the 65” TVs next to it look small. Picture is great, smart remote is kinda dumb though. The biggest problem was delivery. There’s three options when you order a large TV, leave it at the door, bring it in the room, and third set it up and remove the packing. The problem is you never know ahead of time what’s coming. The TV took 2 weeks to arrive after ordering it; half of that time it was sitting on the loading dock of the local trucking company hired to deliver it. A 140 lbs TV was sent out with 2 girls who it outweighed, Had I not helped them, they would have never got the TV in the elevator; some fancy 3 plane manipulation was required. They were only a delivery service, an 82” TV was sent out with no setup. You can’t unbox something this size, you cut the box away. It took an hour or so to set it up solo and get on it the stand without overstressing the unit. In the end it worked out. Amazon’s scheduled delivery service states the TV is setup on it’s stand and the packaging is removed; it just didn’t happen in this case.

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Great TV. Heavier than I expected but it IS ...
review_detail.content: Great TV. Heavier than I expected but it IS a 55". Great picture quality and great features. The only gripe I have, which others may have mentioned is the power cord. Samsung what are you doing? The power cord is shorter then most cords AND with their wire management system it's impossible to use if you don't have an outlet directly behind the TV. Great for wall-mounting but most TVs sit on a stand. We had to opt not to use their wire management built in. Our TV is going on a swivel stand but even still, the cord is going to be shorter then it needs to be. Big downfall there on Samsungs part with the short cord. I'm not taking a star off for that but heads up folks. Still an awesome TV and i'd buy it again. The remote is interesting. I have the best/smartest Harmony remote already but am simplifying things and planning to just use their One Remote. I wish they added a few more buttons on the remote for cable boxes (GUIDE BUTTON!) but it's sleek/small and does the job. Still sucks having to use a cable box remote for a GUIDE button though.

review_detail.author: BeachGirl
review_detail.title: Affordable, lightweight, crisp and beautiful images!
review_detail.content: I bought this TV as a spare for my mother's guest room.  I stay over on weekends sometimes and I had the option of either watching something that someone else in the house was watching, or squinting over a small laptop screen while watching movies in the guest bed.  Both those options got old real quick, I was low on funds due to pricey Christmas purchases and wanted something of an average size, and for less than $200.  All I was finding were subpar brands I had never heard of, but I continued looking and my perseverance paid off when I found this Samsung TV that met all my requirements.  It was of the great quality and performance I have come to expect from Samsung televisions.  Setting it up was easy, not to mention, how light it was.  I lifted it by myself, set it on the bed, inserted the feet, and put it on the cabinet.  I own two Samsung TVs at my condo, both are LCDs, but weigh significantly more than this one (they are also over 10 years old and work flawlessly, a testament to the quality of Samsung electronics).  The image on this TV is sharp, colors are beautiful, and best of all, it was extremely affordable, and a brand new 2017 model (I bought it in 2017, so having a brand new model, rather than something a year or two old, was awesome).  Does the job, and very well! By the way, my mother bought herself a Toshiba which would not play anything off a thumb drive.  This TV cost me less than her Toshiba and will open and play thumb drives, for those wondering.  I also connected my Fire Stick and it works great.

review_detail.author: Eric Walker
review_detail.title: For the Prime Day Deal, this really was a steal!
review_detail.content: I've used Fire TV Sticks and the Fire TV before it was the silly pendant thing you can buy nowadays. Thought they were great devices, but had an interest in replacing a TV and figured "why not have it integrated?" It was between the Roku-powered TCL 5-series that never made it down to a price point I had to buy, and then came the Prime Day deal on the 43". I was replacing a Samsung 40" LCD that's 10+ years old, so ironically the footprint of the 43" was slightly smaller. Picture quality is plenty fine and the app integration is nice. I was pleasantly surprised with the integration of the TV antenna and HDMI inputs, very smooth and I like the instant preview of the tuner in the interface without having to truly switch to it.

Product: Toshiba 43-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.author: Nick
review_detail.title: Amazing Value
review_detail.content: I’m amazed how much of a TV I got on Prime day for $250. The picture is amazing, the sound is good, and I like the interface and especially the voice remote. Even if you aren’t as tech-savvy as me, the voice remote can help you navigate between the apps on the tv with relative ease. I’ve seen TVs in Walmart this size that cost more than this one and I don’t see the difference. This one looks just as good to me, especially since I was upgrading from a 26 inch LCD that was about 9 years old. What a night and day difference, wow.

Huge fan of FireTV. The 4K image is stunning, especially for movies from Amazon and Netflix. The TV doesn't ship with the silly frame interpolation that many do, making 24 fps movies look like soap operas, and it doesn't default to super color saturation, either. Least amount of adjustment I've had to do on a new TV.

review_detail.title: Always call the company direct with any issue.
review_detail.content: Hi all. This is going to be a little long but it may help you.  I bought this tv connected the HDMI got beautiful picture but could not get sound from the tv.  We thought tv was broken and returned it and got same tv. (Great first experience returning btw) when we got home we connected all wires etc.  but again no tv sound with cable HDMI I thought it may be the HDMI wire so we got a new one. Still no sound. Called cable to come and check maybe the box is too old still same problem. We were going to return the 2nd tv but my husband decided to call toshiba first just in case. With in two min few settings that no one or me tried before and I would never dream would make a diff they got us going.  Thank you toshiba customer service and good luck to any one experiencing such an issue.

Product: Toshiba 43-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.author: Chris
review_detail.title: Very Happy!
review_detail.content: I haven't bought a new tv for 3 or 4 years (save for a 32'' Prime Day deal for use at a camp) mainly because I never bought into the 4k hype.

Product: Toshiba 43-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.author: PharmD
review_detail.title: Love this tv
review_detail.content: Besides the fact that I got a 50” 4K smart tv for $289, cause that’s pretty insane.....I’m happy with this tv even if I had paid a lot more. The picture is great and the smart functionality is much better than my Sony 55” that cost a lot more. I really like how it merges the inputs (over the air antenna, PlayStation vue, etc.) into one “On Now” line where you just choose what to watch and the tv worries about which input it is behind the scenes. Voice control is decent and useful, but it does need some tweaks or upgrades. Ability to rewind and pause live tv off an antenna is great and I can’t do that on other TVs in the house that I paid more for. If these are on sale again for Black Friday I’ll convince myself I “need” another one.

Product: Toshiba 55-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.author: Eric Walker
review_detail.title: For the Prime Day Deal, this really was a steal!
review_detail.content: I've used Fire TV Sticks and the Fire TV before it was the silly pendant thing you can buy nowadays. Thought they were great devices, but had an interest in replacing a TV and figured "why not have it integrated?" It was between the Roku-powered TCL 5-series that never made it down to a price point I had to buy, and then came the Prime Day deal on the 43". I was replacing a Samsung 40" LCD that's 10+ years old, so ironically the footprint of the 43" was slightly smaller. Picture quality is plenty fine and the app integration is nice. I was pleasantly surprised with the integration of the TV antenna and HDMI inputs, very smooth and I like the instant preview of the tuner in the interface without having to truly switch to it.

Product: Toshiba 55-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.author: Nick
review_detail.title: Amazing Value
review_detail.content: I’m amazed how much of a TV I got on Prime day for $250. The picture is amazing, the sound is good, and I like the interface and especially the voice remote. Even if you aren’t as tech-savvy as me, the voice remote can help you navigate between the apps on the tv with relative ease. I’ve seen TVs in Walmart this size that cost more than this one and I don’t see the difference. This one looks just as good to me, especially since I was upgrading from a 26 inch LCD that was about 9 years old. What a night and day difference, wow.

Product: Toshiba 55-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.author: Jeff Putz
review_detail.title: Insanely great value, great image
review_detail.content: Smart TVs are kind of dumb, because they don't always get updated consistently. Since this one is actually a TV with Amazon FireTV built in, the apps don't get stale. Huge fan of FireTV. The 4K image is stunning, especially for movies from Amazon and Netflix. The TV doesn't ship with the silly frame interpolation that many do, making 24 fps movies look like soap operas, and it doesn't default to super color saturation, either. Least amount of adjustment I've had to do on a new TV.

Product: Toshiba 55-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.content: During Prime Day I purchased a 50” Toshiba Fire TV, sold by Best Buy. At the same time, I had an Xfinity XR15 box replacement sent so I could take advantage of the TVs 4K Ultra.

review_detail.author: Mialiat Rejwan
review_detail.title: Overall awesome TV and really sleek design.
review_detail.content: Purchased this on Prime day for an awesome price. I'm glad I did, I definitely love the TV. It has Netflix and YouTube (not so much a YouTube user but SO stoked to have Netflix without needing my Apple TV in two different rooms), and the design of the unit as a whole is really sleek. One of the few things I've been slightly bothered is the sound quality. I'm going to have to buy a sound bar or some other kind of speaker set because the TV speakers aren't great and I've had to have it turned nearly all the way up with majority of the things I watch. Otherwise it's been pretty awesome. The only reason I'm not giving picture quality 5-stars is because it's been glitching a bit; it could be due to Comcast, but it's still 50/50...I'll update later if that changes. It's definitely a light weight TV, however once you've placed it on whatever surface you're using it's kind of difficult to maneuver it around. It can be a bit wobbly, just trying to pick it up to adjust it the base can feel a little unstable and make the TV feel slightly top heavy. Again, for the most part it's been an awesome TV and I'm super happy I was able to snag it.

Product: LG Electronics 49UK6300PUE 49-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Joseph M.
review_detail.title: I've bought Sony, and Samsung, and Vizio, all were very good, and the LG is joining them.
review_detail.content: The LG replaced one of the best TV's I ever had. I had a 15 year old Samsung DLP, but not just a DLP, it was the best DLP ever made. No light bulbs, no spinning mirrors, no moving parts. After 12 or 13 years, it started getting white spots, so I  replaced the DLP chip myself and it was great again until the remote, and switches would not respond, So in comes the 65" LG, this is the biggest I've bought so far, the others were 62", and a little smaller. This one is big in the bedroom, it's like being at a drive-in. The color is good, nothing blares out to me in the picture that I could complain about. I should tell you that I know  what a good picture should look like, and there are a lot of bad TV out there. The LG has a setup that it takes you through to set it up, that was OK.  I got rid of DirecTV, and use DirecTVNow through a 4k FireTV box, and it works really well, and cut my TV bill by 75% . You do have to have Internet to get DirecTVNow, it is a streaming service, but it works really well for me. They gave me 125 channels, and HBO for $55 a month, plus I can record.  It's all new, and so far, so good. The LG looked really good on my FireTV, and  DirecTVNow, which is an app on the FireTV.  I did buy a sound bar with a floor standing woofer, but to be honest, the LG was the first really flat Tv to have decent sound. The sound bar and woofer were a bit better, but not so much that I would cry if I didn't have it. It was a Vizio soundbar I bought in a local club store. The TV box came double boxed by Fedex, and the Fedex guy brought it inside, but wanted to leave it outside and make me bring it in. The TV is light, and you have to put legs on it. each leg takes three screws, and they are labeled A and B, so pay attention, or the Tv might be tipsy on you if you put them on backwards.  This TV was bought with a 4 year warranty, yes, it cost a little more, but read the details,  they fix it in your home, and if they can't fix it they refund your money, how can you beat that. I keep all my electronics on a UPS  battery backup. I live in the lightning belt, and lightening will kill a TV, and many other electronics things very easily. Worse than that, it can cause a hard to find problem, one that many TV repair shops might have trouble fixing. It can even cause multiple problems, making it even harder to fix. I have been on UPS battery backup for 20 years, and yes , I have to replace batteries, and and in some cases I had to replace the UPS, that is way better than having all sorts of problems with my TV's, and other electronics stuff. This LG Tv is a bargain, it is a 2018 model, and supports Google Home, and Amazon Alesis . It has bluetooth to connect to a  bluetooth sound bar.. So let me share my experience in the local club store when I bought the sound bar.  I asked if any of them come with wire connections to the TV , as well as Bluetooth.  I worked in electronics my whole life, and I would rather use wire. In any case, he said no, they all use bluetooth, no wire. So I get it home and open the box and there is an optical cable, a 3,5mm cable, and one other cable, so there was 4 ways to connect that sound bar to my TV, not just Bluetooth. So  I used the Toslink optical cable to connect the sound bar, but now, about the TV and the sound bar. I had the center channel working on the optical cable, and before that I had it on the 3.5mm wire to my cell phone to hear what it sounded like. When the TV came on it dropped the woofer, which does connect with Bluetooth to the sound bar.  So I turned the TV off, and back on, and that was all it needed,  all the sound came on as it should. No hassle, it just did its thing and worked. Their are a lot of apps in this TV, so if you are not fortunate enough to have FireTv with a Prime account, which is awesome, and I highly recommend it, the Tv has a lot of other streaming services built into it.  One of them is Amazon, but that way of getting Amazon content, in no way compares to FireTV, but there are many other apps also.. You can also plus a USB thumb drive , or maybe even a usb hard drive into the back of the TV and watch video, pictures and music from it, It works really well. Then there are plenty of HDMI connectors, although I only needed one.  The remote does leave a little room to complain, the buttons could have been bigger, especially the ones you would use in the dark. Ok, I can replace the remote with a programmable touch screen, but why should i need to do that? Are you reading this LG, get with it , make a great remote for this great TV.  You should be able to get 12 to 14, or more feet from a screen this big,  Some people get lemons, some people don't know what a good picture is, and some people just like to complain, try to know the difference when you read reviews.

Product: LG Electronics 65UK6300PUE 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Joseph M.
review_detail.title: I've bought Sony, and Samsung, and Vizio, all were very good, and the LG is joining them.
review_detail.content: The LG replaced one of the best TV's I ever had. I had a 15 year old Samsung DLP, but not just a DLP, it was the best DLP ever made. No light bulbs, no spinning mirrors, no moving parts. After 12 or 13 years, it started getting white spots, so I  replaced the DLP chip myself and it was great again until the remote, and switches would not respond, So in comes the 65" LG, this is the biggest I've bought so far, the others were 62", and a little smaller. This one is big in the bedroom, it's like being at a drive-in. The color is good, nothing blares out to me in the picture that I could complain about. I should tell you that I know  what a good picture should look like, and there are a lot of bad TV out there. The LG has a setup that it takes you through to set it up, that was OK.  I got rid of DirecTV, and use DirecTVNow through a 4k FireTV box, and it works really well, and cut my TV bill by 75% . You do have to have Internet to get DirecTVNow, it is a streaming service, but it works really well for me. They gave me 125 channels, and HBO for $55 a month, plus I can record.  It's all new, and so far, so good. The LG looked really good on my FireTV, and  DirecTVNow, which is an app on the FireTV.  I did buy a sound bar with a floor standing woofer, but to be honest, the LG was the first really flat Tv to have decent sound. The sound bar and woofer were a bit better, but not so much that I would cry if I didn't have it. It was a Vizio soundbar I bought in a local club store. The TV box came double boxed by Fedex, and the Fedex guy brought it inside, but wanted to leave it outside and make me bring it in. The TV is light, and you have to put legs on it. each leg takes three screws, and they are labeled A and B, so pay attention, or the Tv might be tipsy on you if you put them on backwards.  This TV was bought with a 4 year warranty, yes, it cost a little more, but read the details,  they fix it in your home, and if they can't fix it they refund your money, how can you beat that. I keep all my electronics on a UPS  battery backup. I live in the lightning belt, and lightening will kill a TV, and many other electronics things very easily. Worse than that, it can cause a hard to find problem, one that many TV repair shops might have trouble fixing. It can even cause multiple problems, making it even harder to fix. I have been on UPS battery backup for 20 years, and yes , I have to replace batteries, and and in some cases I had to replace the UPS, that is way better than having all sorts of problems with my TV's, and other electronics stuff. This LG Tv is a bargain, it is a 2018 model, and supports Google Home, and Amazon Alesis . It has bluetooth to connect to a  bluetooth sound bar.. So let me share my experience in the local club store when I bought the sound bar.  I asked if any of them come with wire connections to the TV , as well as Bluetooth.  I worked in electronics my whole life, and I would rather use wire. In any case, he said no, they all use bluetooth, no wire. So I get it home and open the box and there is an optical cable, a 3,5mm cable, and one other cable, so there was 4 ways to connect that sound bar to my TV, not just Bluetooth. So  I used the Toslink optical cable to connect the sound bar, but now, about the TV and the sound bar. I had the center channel working on the optical cable, and before that I had it on the 3.5mm wire to my cell phone to hear what it sounded like. When the TV came on it dropped the woofer, which does connect with Bluetooth to the sound bar.  So I turned the TV off, and back on, and that was all it needed,  all the sound came on as it should. No hassle, it just did its thing and worked. Their are a lot of apps in this TV, so if you are not fortunate enough to have FireTv with a Prime account, which is awesome, and I highly recommend it, the Tv has a lot of other streaming services built into it.  One of them is Amazon, but that way of getting Amazon content, in no way compares to FireTV, but there are many other apps also.. You can also plus a USB thumb drive , or maybe even a usb hard drive into the back of the TV and watch video, pictures and music from it, It works really well. Then there are plenty of HDMI connectors, although I only needed one.  The remote does leave a little room to complain, the buttons could have been bigger, especially the ones you would use in the dark. Ok, I can replace the remote with a programmable touch screen, but why should i need to do that? Are you reading this LG, get with it , make a great remote for this great TV.  You should be able to get 12 to 14, or more feet from a screen this big,  Some people get lemons, some people don't know what a good picture is, and some people just like to complain, try to know the difference when you read reviews.

review_detail.author: Norman
review_detail.title: Gamers Beware! This is a 60 Hz TV.
review_detail.content: WARNING! this is NOT a 120 Hz tv! it is a 60 Hz. look up what MEMC 120 means. It means it takes the 120 fully generated frames a second my pc sends, throws 60 of them away takes 60 of the frames, and tries to predict what the other 60 frames mite end up being if it hadn't thrown them away. If you are watching a movie it's not good but it works OK unless you're watching a lot of action then it's poor. Gamers beware! it has no way to predict how you will move in a 3D world and will act simply as a 60 Hz TV. 2 stars because the picture is fine.

The two things to be aware of are 1) that the speakers fire downward toward the base, so stereo definition is nonexistent and if you put this on a surface that absorbs sound (like a fluffy tablecloth) it won't be very loud, and 2) that the horizontal view angle is great but the image contrast quickly goes to heck with vertical angle -- if you put this at typical kitchen countertop height and stand a foot in front of it you won't like what you see (unless you're five feet tall or less), but if you step back a couple more feet it's fine.

review_detail.author: sixerb
review_detail.title: Flickering issues 1st day & Amazon wouldn't replace it-Prime Day deal was too good apparently
review_detail.content: We bought this 50 inch TV on Prime Day.  The picture is a screen shot of a video I took and not very good representation.  Upon setting it up the TV had flickering lines and squares in random places on the screen.  This occurred no matter what app was being used.  I contacted Amazon, Best Buy, and Toshiba via phone to attempt to replace the TV with the same model.  Amazon stated that I could only return the TV.  Best Buy stated that they would replace it, but I had to go through Amazon, and Amazon refused to replace it.  I went to Best Buy locally, and they stated that they could not override Amazon's return policy for Prime Day electronics.  I contacted Toshiba to attempt to utilize the warranty, but they stated that since it was new they would not replace it and that I needed to return it to Amazon.  So I had to take it apart (no biggie) and place it back inside of the box.  Luckily I had the box and styrofoam inserts still.  Then I had to lug it to a UPS store to send it back to Amazon for a refund.  I will never buy electronics on Prime Day again.  The great price was the reason that Amazon and Best Buy stated that the TV would not be replaced.  Now I have to wait for either Labor Day sales or Black Friday sales to get a good deal on a TV locally.  Thanks a lot Amazon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Product: Toshiba 55-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.author: orbofshingeki
review_detail.title: One of the Best Tv's for the Money
review_detail.content: Now. let me start off with saying that i'm not an expert on TV's. My first HDTV was a Vizio 42 inch 1080p that i bought almost 5 years ago after high school. It looked great. I Paid $420 for it. I thought i got a pretty good deal on it. Fast forward to 2018 and 4k is still settling in and technology is moving forward. I was at work during Prime week and the website was terribly slow but i still wanted to see what they had in stock. I stumbled across this TV as i was going to be in the market for one during the holiday season 2018. When i found this TV, I was shocked at how much it was! $280! For a 50 inch 4k Fire TV with Alex built in, That's almost half the cost of my old vizio. I thought it was too good to be true. Reviews were mixed but i wanted to take a stab at it anyways. I ordered it and it was here 3 days later. My initial impressions were "eh". Setup was a breeze but there was more than that i had noticed. I decided on comparing it with my vizio with some Good Mythical Morning on YouTube. I Know it's compressed video but it was the best i had to work with at first. I watched one episode and I was kind of Disappointed. The Brightness was good but the color was kind of dull overall and over saturated on some parts of the image like a person's face, but i wasn't giving up there. Setting the TV's Picture color setting from default to natural completely changed the game. The Color was great! Everything seemed correct with pulling up a color correction test on YouTube and it looked great! The Speakers were OK but that doesn't bother me because i have a dedicated 5.1 Surround System that blows the socks on the TV speakers. I really wanted a bigger size TV overall since the 42 inch wasn't quite the size I wanted. The 50 Inch was the perfect size for my TV stand and it matched the room which is a pretty small living room but it worked just fine. Now it's $400 and i still think it's a good deal considering my 42 inch was $20 more. I run the TV 1080p still because my laptop does not output 4k but It still looks great. The Fire TV portion is good for what it offers. More Ad's than I liked but for the value, No big deal. The 4k Netflix Shows look great. HDR Looks really good. The only downside to this TV for me is when i'm playing Dolby Digital through any apps on the smart portion of the TV, the volume seems to fluctuate. I would give it a go if you're interested in getting a good TV for the Money and hey if It doesn't work out, 30 Day Return!

review_detail.author: sixerb
review_detail.title: Flickering issues 1st day & Amazon wouldn't replace it-Prime Day deal was too good apparently
review_detail.content: We bought this 50 inch TV on Prime Day.  The picture is a screen shot of a video I took and not very good representation.  Upon setting it up the TV had flickering lines and squares in random places on the screen.  This occurred no matter what app was being used.  I contacted Amazon, Best Buy, and Toshiba via phone to attempt to replace the TV with the same model.  Amazon stated that I could only return the TV.  Best Buy stated that they would replace it, but I had to go through Amazon, and Amazon refused to replace it.  I went to Best Buy locally, and they stated that they could not override Amazon's return policy for Prime Day electronics.  I contacted Toshiba to attempt to utilize the warranty, but they stated that since it was new they would not replace it and that I needed to return it to Amazon.  So I had to take it apart (no biggie) and place it back inside of the box.  Luckily I had the box and styrofoam inserts still.  Then I had to lug it to a UPS store to send it back to Amazon for a refund.  I will never buy electronics on Prime Day again.  The great price was the reason that Amazon and Best Buy stated that the TV would not be replaced.  Now I have to wait for either Labor Day sales or Black Friday sales to get a good deal on a TV locally.  Thanks a lot Amazon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

That's a BIG drawback. One is forced to go to the menu each time or use the navigation button, another avenue for the menu. Sucks.

Product: Toshiba 43-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV with HDR - Fire TV Edition

review_detail.author: orbofshingeki
review_detail.title: One of the Best Tv's for the Money
review_detail.content: Now. let me start off with saying that i'm not an expert on TV's. My first HDTV was a Vizio 42 inch 1080p that i bought almost 5 years ago after high school. It looked great. I Paid $420 for it. I thought i got a pretty good deal on it. Fast forward to 2018 and 4k is still settling in and technology is moving forward. I was at work during Prime week and the website was terribly slow but i still wanted to see what they had in stock. I stumbled across this TV as i was going to be in the market for one during the holiday season 2018. When i found this TV, I was shocked at how much it was! $280! For a 50 inch 4k Fire TV with Alex built in, That's almost half the cost of my old vizio. I thought it was too good to be true. Reviews were mixed but i wanted to take a stab at it anyways. I ordered it and it was here 3 days later. My initial impressions were "eh". Setup was a breeze but there was more than that i had noticed. I decided on comparing it with my vizio with some Good Mythical Morning on YouTube. I Know it's compressed video but it was the best i had to work with at first. I watched one episode and I was kind of Disappointed. The Brightness was good but the color was kind of dull overall and over saturated on some parts of the image like a person's face, but i wasn't giving up there. Setting the TV's Picture color setting from default to natural completely changed the game. The Color was great! Everything seemed correct with pulling up a color correction test on YouTube and it looked great! The Speakers were OK but that doesn't bother me because i have a dedicated 5.1 Surround System that blows the socks on the TV speakers. I really wanted a bigger size TV overall since the 42 inch wasn't quite the size I wanted. The 50 Inch was the perfect size for my TV stand and it matched the room which is a pretty small living room but it worked just fine. Now it's $400 and i still think it's a good deal considering my 42 inch was $20 more. I run the TV 1080p still because my laptop does not output 4k but It still looks great. The Fire TV portion is good for what it offers. More Ad's than I liked but for the value, No big deal. The 4k Netflix Shows look great. HDR Looks really good. The only downside to this TV for me is when i'm playing Dolby Digital through any apps on the smart portion of the TV, the volume seems to fluctuate. I'm sure this can be fixed with a software update but It's what i experienced. I would give it a go if you're interested in getting a good TV for the Money and hey if It doesn't work out, 30 Day Return!

review_detail.author: Jim
review_detail.title: My UN55NU8000 has a Beautiful Picture but has a Sound Problem
review_detail.content: I ordered it on Monday and it was delivered on Wednesday. I mounted it on my new stand and was watching it that afternoon. I am not very technically oriented and have not yet managed to completely set it up and that may be part of my problem in selecting what I want to use as the input but eventually, I manage to get see my computer or Hard Disk Players, but it usually takes me a while to manage that. Like I said, the picture is beautiful but the second day, the sound from my Speaker System suddenly started sounding sort of like a studdering. This happened while I was playing a recorded program from my HDD player. I stopped the playback and then restarted it and the sound was all right again. This has happened a number of times since then. Earlier today I was watching an over the air broadcast and for the first time, the OTA sound started the studdering and in order to get it to stop, I had to turn off the channel and then go back to it. I am old and I wear hearing aids in both ears so what I hear may not sound too me like it would to someone else. The fact that I have been unable to completely set up the NU8000 could possibly be part of the problem, however, having read the reviews, quite a few of them mention a sound coming from their NU8000's also. I have previously bought seven Samsung TV,s, this one being number eight and there had never been a problem with any of the previous seven.

review_detail.author: Scott M. E
review_detail.title: Please Read - Detailed Summary for the "worried user"
review_detail.content: I spent close 20 hours of research on TV's (sadly not kidding). Through my research I learned about all the new specs and what specs make a good TV like: LED, 4K, HDR, WCG, 120 hrtz etc. besides WCG, this TV has them all for at affordable price, NOTHING comes close. People are so caught up on 4K.. HDR (High Dynamic Range) make a better difference to the eye than 4K (Google it). Now there are two types of HDR, some have both but this one has HDR10 which is the endustry standard (Dolby Vision HDR is better but not as popular and barely can tell a difference). Let me say I was so worried that this TV would ship and I would be upset. This was not the case... the TV comes with Roku (a value in itself) and a very user friendly remote. Some people complain about the viewing angles and sound but to be honest - I really don't think it's bad, like at all (obviously not the best). Not enough to really complain. When I tested an HDR video on the YouTube app (search hdr) I was amazed. The blacks are so rich.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Reviewing Parent
review_detail.title: I like the concept but
review_detail.content: On the fence about this TV. Bought, set it up easily and seemed to work well.  I like that it had all the roku options and I only needed one remote for everything. Image is sometimes dark around the perimeter but considering the cost I was overall pleased until I wasn't. We were watching tv and all of a sudden it restarts itself but that's not the worst part. After doing that it a crackling noise started to come from the back of the TV. To me I associate the sound it was making with something that is about to catch fire electronically. So I quickly unplugged it, cleared everything away and got a fire extinguisher. Gave it some time, turned it back on and it made the noise again, figured I'd unplug and leave it off for a while. I'm not comfortable using it or leaving it plugged in when not in the house,the few times I have used it, the noise did not return but I don't want to take the risk.  I had posted a question asking if anyone else had had this issue but no one else has. TCL's customer service did respond to me and advised me to send an email referencing the question etc,  I did send an email as soon as I had all the information I thought they would want and included the amazon order. I have not heard back from them so since my time is running out (30 day return policy) I am probably going to return it to be on the safe side and get something a little more expensive but hopefully without this possible danger.

The delay seems to be as advertised, not top-tier CS:GO good, but fine enough for fighting games online which have they're own amount of ms delay. I have the 49-inch version and it's almost too much display, almost. I couldn't justify my preferred 43in size with only a 10 dollar difference. Took stars off for the 3 small clusters of dead pixels(thought there was more, but that was lint), but at I hadn't even noticed until I was on this white page to write the review.

review_detail.author: Keith B. White
review_detail.title: Not an effective “Outdoor” TV
review_detail.content: We purchased the TV to be left mounted in our screened in patio.  Unfortunately the door on the back of the TV (housing sensitive elements) doesn’t allow for the unit to be hung onto a TV stand as it sticks out too far.  We had to remove the door so we could mount it; rendering the most important feature of the TV (being able to store it outside on a patio in the humidity) ineffective. The panel inside of the rear door houses open ports that need to be protected from weather.  Even if the door hadn’t prevented us from mounting it, simply plugging in the cord from the TV to the cable box (which then doesn’t allow for the door to close) would have required us to keep the door open, thereby exposing the sensitive parts to the weather anyway.

review_detail.author: Rodney Brown
review_detail.title: Very pleased with this Sony TV
review_detail.content: I am very pleased with this Sony TV. It has a nice bright and clear picture. Computerized electronic devices are getting smarter, but my brain is shrinking. Our TV died, so we ordered thus one from Amazon. It arrived in a week (🙂). Opened the box and hauled out the "Quick Start" guide. That turned out to be a couple of sheets of diagrams that were drawn by a crazed engineer, so were discarded. I did manage to screw on the feet, locate the HDMI ports and "audio out" port so that I could hook up my cable Tivo box, Apple TV box, Amazon Fire TV box, Blu-ray DVD player, and my external speakers. Turned the TV on and all I got was a message that said "checking for updates" and a spinning circle. After 45 minutes I turned the TV off and back on and then it let me set up the TV. Wanted to make some settings changes to the TV and it took FOREVER to locate the "Settings' menu, which was cleverly located in a very inconspicuous place. Had to enter passwords for Netflix and Amazon Prime. Tried to get cable Tivo controller to control TV functions, but had to give up and get our local cable tech to do it. He did it in about 30 seconds. The Mariners game on Wednesday was going to be broadcast only on Facebook, so I had to download the Facebook app. Once I downloaded it, it took me forever to locate it on my Amazon Fire TV  Home screen. After 4 days of frustration, lots of Googling, and much stress, everything seems to be working properly. I need to get one of our kids or grandkids to live with us permanently to deal with all of these "smart" electronic devices.

Product: Sony XBR65X900F 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: R. Hyde
review_detail.title: Really enjoy the great video on the TV
review_detail.content: Really enjoy the great video on the TV. Great color and handles motion well. Works great with Apple TV and watching movies in HDR. Set up was pretty easy. Use a sound bar, so have not evaluated the sound. Very satisfied. Packed very well for delivery.

Product: Sony XBR65X900F 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Darnell
review_detail.title: Not a huge improvement over last year's model but still a great buy.
review_detail.content: So far I don't have any issues with this set. The picture quality is really good. I watched Planet Earth 2 without really messing with the settings and was blown away. I had a huge smile on my face, I'm gonna start doing some calibrations to really have this tv show me what it can do. Compared to the x900e the improvement isn't that much noticeable to me (you videophiles are welcomed to prove me wrong) so if Dolby Vision (future update) isn't something you really need, go ahead with the x900e as the current prices on it are really good, you will not be disappointed. I do highly recommend the 2018 set though.

Product: Sony XBR65X900F 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Jaxsun
review_detail.title: Picture is not great on my set
review_detail.content: I did a lot of research and ended up with the x900f 65 totally based on all the great reviews.  After a week, I am very disappointed.  When it switches between scenes, or switching from a commercial back to live, the colors and brightness change all over the place.  Watching golf, a guy on the green putting from some distance away appears distorted - face is smeared out.  A minute later, on a close up, the face is clear as can be.  I don't think it's the camera man. I've tried running hdmi straight from my xfinity x1 box to IN-2 and IN-3 to eliminate my AVR.  I tried eliminating xfinity as well by going to Prime and watching Star Trek Beyond allegedly in 4K.  (In these apps, the Display doesn't show what resolution you are getting).  I watched simultaneously with my 8 year old Panasonic 3d tv and x900f was only slightly better.  I have tweaked all the settings using rtings recommendations.  These settings produce an overblown vivid color rendition that is unacceptable.  As to other questions:  Does x900f upscale to 4K automatically?  If so, Display only shows a resolution of 1080.  Is that correct?  When I go to the Action Menu and to Picture settings, there is a pause of 5 to 10 seconds before the sub menu appears on the right side of the screen.  Took me awhile to wait it out.  Either I have a bad tv or ...?  Unless I can get it improved, I am going to have to return it.  Anybody have any ideas?

Product: Sony XBR65X900F 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Hi!
review_detail.title: 5 stars.
review_detail.content: The Sony x900f is a great TV. With the new X1 extreme chip inside of it this year  handles 4k content amazingly, and upscales cable and 1080p content to near 4k quality. Deep blacks and beautiful colors. I also own a Sony x930e the baby Z9D. and this tv comes close to that. Just not as bright. Full-array local-dimming is the way to go these days. PlayStation 4 Pro looks amazing on this TV the way the X1 extreme chip boosts the 4k and HDR to native 4k is flawless... I used to own the Sony x900e took it back for the 930e. This TV is slightly better than the 900e because of the X1 extreme chipset . The Android operating system runs a lot faster and smoother. All in all you cannot go wrong with Sony. I'm very happy with the tv. And I do recommend this year's 900 series. I'm loving my Sony Tv's. Next purchase surround sound!!!

review_detail.title: Beautiful color, slim design
review_detail.content: We are loving this TV. The vibrant colors of the display blow out old plasma out of the water. The screen is ultra thin and could hand very close to the wall. We chose to use the provided TV stand. It was relatively easy to put the stand on and it has a very low profile so you dont notice it when you look at the TV. The one connect box from what I understand is how they were able to make.the TV so slim. It is the source of all your apps and TV built Ins. The box is about the size of a small shoe box and comes with a very long plug so it can be stored away from the TV as necessary. The TVs interface is very easy to use. We only have hulu and netflix and they pop up on the TVs main home screen. The remote is simplistic and provides al the functionality necessary for the tv. The remote is quite small so we have misplaced it a few times already. Over all we love this TV.

The quality is amazing -- I would never believe it cost as little as it does.........this won't last. You won't regret purchasing this!

Product: TCL 55C807 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: William E.
review_detail.title: Once you go 4K... you can never go back
review_detail.content: This TV is amazing! It looks spectacular. I watched the NASCAR races with the TV and the 4k looks incredible. It is also good for gaming. There isn't any noticeable input lag and playing games on my Xbox One X in 4k is stunning. Halo 5 and Halo 2 Anniversary were already good looking but look even better on a 4k TV. The remote even came with earbuds which are also great quality.

Product: TCL 55C807 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Anna Rusch
review_detail.title: We couldn’t be happier with this TV
review_detail.content: We couldn’t be happier with this TV.  Great price, and everything about it was easy to understand and every step of buying online was turn key.  We had never bought a TV online before.  The info on TCL’s website, buying on Amazon, the team that delivered the TV, and using the TV – have all been so simple, and impressive.

Product: TCL 55C807 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: CrossCountry
review_detail.title: Great tv at an amazing price. Beats Samsung
review_detail.content: Love this tv!  I do not have cable but only wireless internet. I am a senior citizen. The only issue I had with the tv was the remote needed to be replaced which Roku did promptly  A downloaded app to my ipad provided me use until the new remote arrived.  That app worked perfectly and nifty to know the option exists. Now I also purchased a new 2017 Samsung tv...for the comparison, I believe the Samsung has a bit of an edge on a better picture, but the TCL blows it away for ability to constant stream without buffering, (though situated further from the router), its ability to download any app (Samsung cannot) and it is simply super easy to use. Doing it again, I would not have purchased the Samsung. The TCL price is amazing for a really great tv. I have learned that any issues are the apps creation. Such as DirectTv was constantly buffering with a lousy video.  Not a problem with Sling or Hulu. So a tiny learning curve with a pleasing outcome.  If it helps, I am using this on the Oregon coast where I face the water.  I have a High speed 100 internet line, because I always use my ipad as I watch tv. I recommend highly this great value.

Product: TCL 55C807 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: John Humphreys
review_detail.title: Great features, very modern.
review_detail.content: Totally awesome features, unbelievable for the price.  Your phone fully controls the TV (as well as the remote obviously).  It integrates great with your PC and it is very fast.  The whole TV operates like an IPad with the menus/etc.  feels like a fast computer that can also play your cable :).  It also looks very sleek with the almost non existent bezel and the modern stand.  Can turn the brightness up/down very easily with a couple buttons from the remote too (great for kids that stand too close) (press *).

Product: TCL 55C807 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: David
review_detail.title: Jitterbug TV
review_detail.content: I keep my parents electronics running. After looking at all options I decided on this TV/TV BOX/computer? as a solution to down time. For being the least complicated way to deliver mountains of entertainment with the lease scary buttons, you still get a beautiful set and an incredible picture. Mom set this handy device up by 1. plug it in. 2. put batteries in remote. 3. turn on set. 4 answer questions including connect to wifi. 5.register roku apps. 6. ENJOY

Product: TCL 55C807 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: 4k Gaming Looks amazing with Xbox One X
review_detail.content: I love this TV. I have been using with my Xbox One X and it looks great. Now I have to say that this is the only 4K tv I have ever owned, so I do not anything to compare it to. The tv itself is razor thin and looks really nice. Sound is decent (better than my Samsung) but would probably still recommend a sound bar. The picture quality is top notch, but the Roku interface is the best I have ever seen on a smart tv. Voice command with the remote is really cool as well. You can also plug headphones into the remote, which I think is a great feature. Overall, I just don’t think you could beat this TV especially for the value. You would need to spend 2x-3x this much to get a 4K tv with Dolby vision.

Product: TCL 55C807 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

Product: TCL 55C807 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.title: Spectacular!

It was easy to install, and setup was a breeze. I must say, I've owned Philips, LG, Sharp and Vizio TV's, but none compared to the picture quality, and smart features this TV has. I am not a professional, but the 4KHD picture quality was unbelievable. It was so lifelike, as though you can reach out and touch it. This photo was taken from a wireless 4KHD feed from YouTube. Can you imagine what a hard-line CAT5 cable would look like.

review_detail.author: Dave Z.
review_detail.title: This TV has been amazing for me
review_detail.content: This TV has been amazing for me.  I have had it for a few months now and I am really thrilled with it.  The picture quality is amazing.  A few things about it to warn, the base is pretty wide, but there's no bottom of it so it's tough to put it on anything other than a flat surface like a table.  I was hoping to rest it on my receiver (it's in a secondary bedroom and it's an old receiver I'm not too concerned if it breaks) but it was just a tad too unstable so I couldn't.  Also the remote is horrible...there's really no other way to say it.  It's cheap and I'd recommend using another remote.  Really any other remote.  But for the basics it does work, I can't really complain except I use Harmony remotes so I'm sort of a snob.  The refresh is great I don't see any artifacts or anything, there is not much heat given off either.  Admittedly I have not tried any of the fine tuning of the picture (if it even offers that) I got this for the bedroom where I watch the occasional movie or game.  But for the price...I couldn't be happier.  Thanks Sceptre!

review_detail.author: Michael Beck
review_detail.title: The picture quality was great, but the remote was subpar and the sound ...
review_detail.content: Owned this TV for 2 years and then one day it died out of nowhere. Before then, it was acceptable. The picture quality was great, but the remote was subpar and the sound was terrible. The remote has to be pointed directly at the bottom center of the tv to work, any deviation by more than a degree or two and the IR signal will not be picked up. The sound from the built in speakers is the worst I have ever heard from a tv. It is absolutely necessary to buy a soundbar or some other speaker/surround sound system. If you already have something to output the audio, the tv will be acceptable, but if you don't, you need to factor that into the price of this tv. After purchasing a soundbar and dealing with the remote, the tv was fine and deserved maybe 3 stars, but don't expect it to last. I hoped I could use it in another room when time came to upgrade (like I have with all of my tv's in the past) but not with this one, it's as good as trash.

review_detail.author: Sultryzulu
review_detail.title: Smart tv, dumb design flaw
review_detail.content: Purchased two of these on Amazon's Prime Day sale.  So far so good.  Replaced a brand new tv from Best Buy that was fine until I turned the sound as high as it would go and it came out tinny.  Which the salesperson said was because I didn't pair it with a sound bar.  I disagreed. I think it's a pretty simple principle that if your tv volume goes up to 100 it should work well up to 100.  Sound bars simply amplify existing quality.  I digress.  Enter the TCL 40in Smart tv.  At it's highest it has excellent sound quality, clear sharp picture image and user friendly settings.  Assembly and connection took less than 30 minutes for both, without help from my honey.  My only issue and it's a big one for me, is that the hdmi ports are placed vertically near the bottom of the unit.  What's wrong with that?  I'm glad you asked.  Take a look at the picture accompanying this review.  See that rectangular depression on the lower right?  That's your hdmi port.  They must not have any common sense courses at MIT because why in the hell would you design a space that was specifically included for attaching media hardware without making accommodations for the size of hardware it's meant to house?  In anticipation of this purchase, I had 2 alexa 2nd generation firesticks waiting for new homes.  Guess what?  Can't use em.  "Alexa, find me an electronics Engineer who can do basic 3rd grade math" returns no results.  Nothing was wrong with my 20 year old fatbacks.  The only reason I bought smart tvs was to replace the cable mafia with firesticks.  You will be able to install a 1st gen (original model) firestick on this tv.  You'll need a metal ruler, some nasa-level precision and a pitcher of sangria.  Via con Dios.

Therefore when you turn the TV on/off your receiver turns on/off as well. Then the volume and mute buttons on the remote control the volume on the receiver. review_detail.author: Michael L. Morrison
review_detail.title: The 2018 Q7 is beyond amazing and has to be seen to be believed
review_detail.content: I just got this TV locally a week ago. Going from a 2015 JS8500.  The 2018 Q7 is beyond amazing and has to be seen to be believed. Although it is not the highest Model  (Q8fn,Q9fn is higher) and is edge lit instead of Array lit, the Q7 is better then the Q8,Q9 in most categories including Uniformity, Color gamut, and brightness. The 2018 Q7 has the WIDEST color Gamut and Color Volume on the market wider then everything including the q9,sony/lg Oleds...  It is also the brightest sustained set on the market at 800 cd/m2 sustained.. Oleds are only about 150 cd/m2.  That brightness translates into shockingly bright brilliant colors and whites. However, even though edge lit.. the ability to produce inky blacks even at full backlight  is amazing. In normal lighting Blacks will look Coal Black, indistinguishable from the TV being off... at night in a dark room the Blacks are not True black like a FALD or Oled, but still - the best ever for an edge lit.. and no clouding or light leakage.. The picture is VERY uniform in both light and dark colors..  The OS is fantastic and fast. Using built in Netflix and youtube is very snapy..

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Beautiful and amazing but a glitchy one connect box keeps it from being flawless!
review_detail.content: This TV is simply beautiful, the thing bezels, its thin profile and how clear and radiant the picture is. As soon as I pulled the Q7F out of the box I knew that this would be an amazing product. Installation was very easy and straightforward and I was able to easily mount it to my existing wall mount. The idea behind having just one cord coming down from the TV is great and makes it very visually appealing especially if you will use ambient mode. Ambient mode is a way for the TV to mimic the colors and decor of your walls so that it can blend it like a picture frame. It is really cool to see but don’t know how often I would really use it. The Tv has worked flawlessly with the built in apps and browser I was able to use all of my normal subscriptions right away and the picture, sound and color is amazing! My only issue has been with the one connect box, the unit I have gotten seems to be defective because it is not recognizing any of the devices that I have connected by hdmi. I even tried doing a factory restore and starting the TV from the beginning but it still did not work. In the end Samsung customer service has said they would send me a new one connect box to replace my defective one. Hopefully that one will actually work. Overall the TV is amazing and hlooks beautiful if they can fix the one connect issues then I would definitely give it 5/5 stars.

Product: Samsung QN55Q7F Flat 55” QLED 4K UHD 7 Series Smart TV 2018

Product: Sony XBR65X850F 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: John Doe
review_detail.title: Picture Quality is TOO good!
review_detail.content: These TV has an amazing picture - almost too good.  Being able to see set and costume imperfections almost detracts from shows that previously looked great.  After getting used to this picture, everything else will look blurry.  Set-up was fast and easy.  We also connected a Sony sound bar/subwoofer, a PlayStation 4, and a Comcast/Charter DVR cable box.  The IR blaster option is a GREAT way to work around remote compatibility issues.  We have tried to have a 1 remote solution for years and have never gotten it quite right.  Now, for the first time, we have a single remote that controls everything.  It is wonderful.  LOVE LOVE LOVE this TV.  We have not been able to get our Alexa to do anything useful other than turn it on and off.  Lesson learned: we went through the set-up process, before connecting the sound-bar.  Once we connected the sound bar, we could not get it to work with menu options.  We had to reset the factory defaults, and then go through the entire set-up process again for the sound-bar to work.  Same thing happened when we then connected to Alexa.  I recommend connecting everything before you start for the first time.  Alexa has been mostly useless, but not sure if that is an Alexa or TV problem.  Menus and not incredibly intuitive or easy to navigate, and many major apps don't support 4K Google TV yet (like VEVO or Amazon Music) - but eventually they will get there.  Even with those shortfalls this is an amazing TV.  Picture and sound quality is the best I have ever had.  Very thin and very attractive.  Bright vibrant colors are sharp and crystal clear.  The blacks are deep and vivid.

Product: Sony XBR65X850F 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Great picture quality
review_detail.content: We've always had Samsung TVs, but the Sony display is just as good. As they say, when buying TVs those are the top 2 makers. Installation was easy as long as you have another pair of hands to help with lifting and such. I would have preferred a swivel stand. This one comes with 2 fixed 'feet' that also hides the cabling in the back. Screen has very thin frame which makes the most of the display size. The colors are rich and pictures very crisp. It uses a bit more power than our old Samsung, so also hoping it doesn't heat up too much. It comes with various apps, which we haven't had a chance to explore yet, beyond getting wifi connected. So far, we're impressed with the picture quality. Movies and sports look fantastic on this screen. Only time will tell how well it holds up.

review_detail.author: P. Berndt
review_detail.title: Well worth the investment
review_detail.content: I've had at least a half a dozen Samsung TV's over the years and had always appreciated the quality. I have not bought one for quite a some time so when I decided it was time to upgrade in the small family room, I decided try my first 4k UHD TV. Set up was really easy. We had this unit set up and working within about 30 minutes and I was immediately struck by the picture quality. Excellent in all modes! I'm not a gamer by any means but my son's Xbox is on it and even I can see the huge difference in picture quality from the other TV's in the house.

Product: Samsung UN82NU8000 Flat 82" 4K UHD 8 Series Smart LED TV (2018)

review_detail.author: Cliff Weed
review_detail.title: TV is fine, delivery is questionable.
review_detail.content: It actually makes the 65” TVs next to it look small. Picture is great, smart remote is kinda dumb though. The biggest problem was delivery. There’s three options when you order a large TV, leave it at the door, bring it in the room, and third set it up and remove the packing. The problem is you never know ahead of time what’s coming. The TV took 2 weeks to arrive after ordering it; half of that time it was sitting on the loading dock of the local trucking company hired to deliver it. A 140 lbs TV was sent out with 2 girls who it outweighed, Had I not helped them, they would have never got the TV in the elevator; some fancy 3 plane manipulation was required. They were only a delivery service, an 82” TV was sent out with no setup. You can’t unbox something this size, you cut the box away. It took an hour or so to set it up solo and get on it the stand without overstressing the unit. In the end it worked out. Amazon’s scheduled delivery service states the TV is setup on it’s stand and the packaging is removed; it just didn’t happen in this case.

Product: Samsung UN82NU8000 Flat 82" 4K UHD 8 Series Smart LED TV (2018)

Product: Samsung UN82NU8000 Flat 82" 4K UHD 8 Series Smart LED TV (2018)

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Great TV. Heavier than I expected but it IS ...
review_detail.content: Great TV. Heavier than I expected but it IS a 55". Great picture quality and great features. The only gripe I have, which others may have mentioned is the power cord. Samsung what are you doing? The power cord is shorter then most cords AND with their wire management system it's impossible to use if you don't have an outlet directly behind the TV. Great for wall-mounting but most TVs sit on a stand. We had to opt not to use their wire management built in. Our TV is going on a swivel stand but even still, the cord is going to be shorter then it needs to be. Big downfall there on Samsungs part with the short cord. I'm not taking a star off for that but heads up folks. Still an awesome TV and i'd buy it again. The remote is interesting. I have the best/smartest Harmony remote already but am simplifying things and planning to just use their One Remote. I wish they added a few more buttons on the remote for cable boxes (GUIDE BUTTON!) but it's sleek/small and does the job. Still sucks having to use a cable box remote for a GUIDE button though.

As of right now- the tv is stunning and the fellas who mounted it admired it. I do too! I'll update if there's any issues but I found that it works as it should. I purchased the Echogear mounting kit, Amazon Basics (3 pack) High Speed HDMI cables, a new optical sound cable, and the Samsung 4k DVD player. I can't vouch for the sound quality of the tv speaker because it's hooked up to a receiver and speakers. All I can say is, "Wow!!!!!". What a great watching experience.

review_detail.author: Jim
review_detail.title: My UN55NU8000 has a Beautiful Picture but has a Sound Problem
review_detail.content: I ordered it on Monday and it was delivered on Wednesday. I mounted it on my new stand and was watching it that afternoon. I am not very technically oriented and have not yet managed to completely set it up and that may be part of my problem in selecting what I want to use as the input but eventually, I manage to get see my computer or Hard Disk Players, but it usually takes me a while to manage that. Like I said, the picture is beautiful but the second day, the sound from my Speaker System suddenly started sounding sort of like a studdering. This happened while I was playing a recorded program from my HDD player. I stopped the playback and then restarted it and the sound was all right again. This has happened a number of times since then. Earlier today I was watching an over the air broadcast and for the first time, the OTA sound started the studdering and in order to get it to stop, I had to turn off the channel and then go back to it. I am old and I wear hearing aids in both ears so what I hear may not sound too me like it would to someone else. The fact that I have been unable to completely set up the NU8000 could possibly be part of the problem, however, having read the reviews, quite a few of them mention a sound coming from their NU8000's also. I have previously bought seven Samsung TV,s, this one being number eight and there had never been a problem with any of the previous seven.

review_detail.author: Mialiat Rejwan
review_detail.title: Overall awesome TV and really sleek design.
review_detail.content: Purchased this on Prime day for an awesome price. I'm glad I did, I definitely love the TV. It has Netflix and YouTube (not so much a YouTube user but SO stoked to have Netflix without needing my Apple TV in two different rooms), and the design of the unit as a whole is really sleek. One of the few things I've been slightly bothered is the sound quality. I'm going to have to buy a sound bar or some other kind of speaker set because the TV speakers aren't great and I've had to have it turned nearly all the way up with majority of the things I watch. Otherwise it's been pretty awesome. The only reason I'm not giving picture quality 5-stars is because it's been glitching a bit; it could be due to Comcast, but it's still 50/50...I'll update later if that changes. It's definitely a light weight TV, however once you've placed it on whatever surface you're using it's kind of difficult to maneuver it around. It can be a bit wobbly, just trying to pick it up to adjust it the base can feel a little unstable and make the TV feel slightly top heavy. Again, for the most part it's been an awesome TV and I'm super happy I was able to snag it.

review_detail.author: Thos Byk
review_detail.title: All the Viewing Angle of a Ten-Year-Old Laptop
review_detail.content: I had no intention of buying a new 4K TV until my 7 year old Samsung started getting a snowy picture. I was completely happy with the old 1080HD set, but apparently a circuit board was going out. This set is almost the same physical size as the old one with a thinner bezel and therefore slightly larger screen. This new set looked perfectly fine when we first began using it, but increasingly it seemed pale on some scenes and washed out. I finally figured out what was happening. I was walking across the room while watching the TV and I noticed a color shift as I moved to the side. I'm not talking about an extreme viewing angle here. I mean just a few feet off center and the picture quality changes. Our set is positioned in the corner of the room and my wife sits directly in front of it about 12 feet away. My chair is exactly 4 feet to the left of hers and just slightly closer. There is a big difference in the picture quality from her chair to mine. I have included photos to illustrate my point. They were shot with a high quality camera with the settings locked so the exposure couldn't change from one comparison photo to the next. One can plainly see in the photos, as well as the naked eye, that the picture quality degrades considerably. Skin tones pale and colors lose their pop.

Product: Samsung Electronics UN50MU6300 50-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: schandna
review_detail.title: Amazing TV!!  Remote sucks though
review_detail.content: Perfect TV!  With a strong wifi connection (I'm using Google fiber in an apt complex), it's flawless with using the apps (Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, etc) to watch tv.  Takes a minute to setup the settings like you want (contrast, clarity, brightness), because out of the box it isn't that great.  Once I got those set - unbelievable!  Couldn't ask for more!  It has 3 HDMI ports, which is perfect for me (and auto detects which source is on), so makes it very easy.  Has an optical out, which again is good for me because I'm running the audio to a sound station.  It has an app (at least for iPhones, not positive about android), which is super cool!  Who wouldn't want full control of your tv through your phone?  It's instant as far as response, and very easy to use!

Product: Samsung Electronics UN50MU6300 50-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Jenna
review_detail.title: Annoying qualities, great picture
review_detail.content: The picture is awesome! The remote is another story. It is great to use for streaming services but is not very compatible with cable receivers. The functionality of the remote is poor and half is the time the voice control does not work. It’s also not compatible with my Bose speaker so I still have to have a control for that. There are features on the tv that you can’t turn off like an annoying chime sound that plays every time you push a button. It is so disruptive when watching something. It also comes loaded with apps that you cannot delete and they fill up all the memory so you can’t add your own content without adding external memory. There are also sponsored ads on the menu screen at all times.

Over the course of the next 36 hours, the black line grew into a black bar.  I had been warned about Samsung electronics, but I was still under warranty, so I figured it couldn't be that bad.  I was wrong.

review_detail.title: Great product for a great price

I am a frugal guy, so the splurge of spending 400+ dollars 10 years ago was a big purchase for me. The same purchase amount got me a TV nearly twice the size and 5x better picture quality.  After returning from vacation to find the TV not working, I ran out to Walmart for a Phillips replacement. I returned it a week later as the picture quality was terrible as compared to the TCL I now have. TCL may not be a mainstream brand for electronics, but I can tell you that you will not be disappointed with this set.

Product: TCL 65S517 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: BigB
review_detail.title: Awesome value! Very Happy!
review_detail.content: I’m very happy with the TV. I originally looked at the entry level model at Costco. Even that model had a better image than other well known brands in the isle. The only thing that looked cheap was the frame and logo. I decided to go with the 55” 517 model from Amazon which has a thinner bezel and the TCL logo is nicer. The panel is a step up as well. The picture is incredible! Roku works well and my wife is enjoying the channels. I connected the HDMI ARC port to my new Samsung Sound Bar’s ARC and can control the sound from the cable remote without any further configuration. The sound turns on and off with the TV. I also added Bias lighting to the rear. The only drawback is that the USB port powering the bias lighting takes 15min to go off after the TV is put in standby. The bottom of the TV has a deeper depth than the top, which is very thin. This left room me to mount and hide my cable box behind the TV on the upper left side. Overall this TV is an awesome value. The quality is equal to or better than others and at a better price point.

Product: TCL 65S517 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Andres Camarena
review_detail.title: Great for console and online gaming
review_detail.content: I wanted a display that could get HDR out of my PS4 Pro and that could be used for online gaming. Setting it up was easy and it works flawlessly with my PS4 Pro. Getting the optimum resolution and framerate was slightly annoying when mirroring my laptop (it was displaying 4k at 30 Hz and I wanted 60 Hz). An article had a series of steps that worked for me. On the TV I manually changed the HDMI inputs to 2.0, restarted the TV in settings, and then I went to the NVIDIA control panel on my laptop to change to 4k at 60 Hz. Playing Overwatch on this display (through HDMI connection from my laptop) was just as comfortable as playing from my laptop directly. It's done everything I've wanted and the price was great. I very highly recommend.

Product: TCL 65S517 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.content: Easy for this mom to unpack, put together and set up. I did it in under 20 minutes and now we’re beyond thrilled with this purchase. I was a little scared to replace our 10 year old Sony with this but am so pleased we picked this. For the price it’s a steal! You get so much with this. Love the simplicity of everything and love that all my entertainment apps are all on my tv. I don’t have to go to different rooms to watch amazon prime and Netflix, they’re both on this TV!

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Very good picture and great Roku OS, but finding a mount was really hard.  Not as easy as just finding a VESA 200x200
review_detail.content: [Updated May 18, 2018]  Awesome Roku operating system.  The picture is very good but took forever to get the picture just the way I wanted it.  If you get the skin tones the way you want it, then some reds are off.  If you get the reds good, then the greens are off, and so on...... So unless you spend a lot of time working on the settings, you will have a compromise.  I spent the time and the picture looks very good now.  You also need to configure the picture for each input source, which means you are going to spend the better part of a day to get everything perfect - or at least perfect for now.  Time will tell.  In comparison to my Samsung UN65JU7100FXZA, which is now about 3yrs old, the Samsung has a better picture right out of the box and no matter how hard you try, you cannot get the TCL to look as good.  It is worth noting that the 3yr old Samsung still costs twice as much new if you can find it.  Overall, you can't beat the value of the TCL 517.  I paid with my Amazon Prime Visa, which got me 5% back and the 4yr warranty was under $25.  I don't normally buy extended warranties, but for $25, why not.
