review_detail.author: Ashley Olsheski
review_detail.title: Was hung up on by a Samsung agent
review_detail.content: I have a 32’ Samsung television I purchased the day after Christmas. This past week the sound has been cutting out for about 1-2 minutes and comes back on. I called Samsung, the first gentleman Kevin gave me some tips to do when I got home, since I was at work. They did not work so I attempted to call Samsung back. I kept getting an automated message stating “your call can not be completed as dialed” so I went on live chat and they gave me a different number. The woman who answered put me on hold three different times, which was fine, but then at the end told me I needed to drive the TV to a repair shop, 50 minutes away mind you, and have them look at it. I told her this was unacceptable as I don’t have access to a car daily and I work 12 hour shifts Monday to Friday. She then told me a technician could come out, at some time to look at the tv. When I told her I would not be able to accomadate this as I don’t have many days off and I can’t wait for a technician to look at a 200$ tv, she said, that’s all we can offer, a technician will be out, then hung up on me. I attempted to call back the same number and again received the automated message that my call was not completed as dialed even though I had just used it. I have never had such terrible customer service and we buy many televisions and electronic devices. All I want is to return the device and get a new one sent or get a refund as this tv is not even 3 months old. So frustrating to think such a reputable company has such poor customer service.

review_detail.author: Thos Byk
review_detail.title: All the Viewing Angle of a Ten-Year-Old Laptop
review_detail.content: I had no intention of buying a new 4K TV until my 7 year old Samsung started getting a snowy picture. I was completely happy with the old 1080HD set, but apparently a circuit board was going out. This set is almost the same physical size as the old one with a thinner bezel and therefore slightly larger screen. This new set looked perfectly fine when we first began using it, but increasingly it seemed pale on some scenes and washed out. I finally figured out what was happening. I was walking across the room while watching the TV and I noticed a color shift as I moved to the side. I'm not talking about an extreme viewing angle here. I mean just a few feet off center and the picture quality changes. Our set is positioned in the corner of the room and my wife sits directly in front of it about 12 feet away. My chair is exactly 4 feet to the left of hers and just slightly closer. There is a big difference in the picture quality from her chair to mine. I have included photos to illustrate my point. They were shot with a high quality camera with the settings locked so the exposure couldn't change from one comparison photo to the next. One can plainly see in the photos, as well as the naked eye, that the picture quality degrades considerably. Skin tones pale and colors lose their pop.

Product: Samsung Electronics UN65MU6300 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: schandna
review_detail.title: Amazing TV!!  Remote sucks though
review_detail.content: Perfect TV!  With a strong wifi connection (I'm using Google fiber in an apt complex), it's flawless with using the apps (Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, etc) to watch tv.  Takes a minute to setup the settings like you want (contrast, clarity, brightness), because out of the box it isn't that great.  Once I got those set - unbelievable!  Couldn't ask for more!  It has 3 HDMI ports, which is perfect for me (and auto detects which source is on), so makes it very easy.  Has an optical out, which again is good for me because I'm running the audio to a sound station.  It has an app (at least for iPhones, not positive about android), which is super cool!  Who wouldn't want full control of your tv through your phone?  It's instant as far as response, and very easy to use!

There are features on the tv that you can’t turn off like an annoying chime sound that plays every time you push a button. It is so disruptive when watching something. It also comes loaded with apps that you cannot delete and they fill up all the memory so you can’t add your own content without adding external memory. review_detail.author: Cliff Weed
review_detail.title: TV is fine, delivery is questionable.
review_detail.content: It actually makes the 65” TVs next to it look small. Picture is great, smart remote is kinda dumb though. The biggest problem was delivery. There’s three options when you order a large TV, leave it at the door, bring it in the room, and third set it up and remove the packing. The problem is you never know ahead of time what’s coming. The TV took 2 weeks to arrive after ordering it; half of that time it was sitting on the loading dock of the local trucking company hired to deliver it. A 140 lbs TV was sent out with 2 girls who it outweighed, Had I not helped them, they would have never got the TV in the elevator; some fancy 3 plane manipulation was required. They were only a delivery service, an 82” TV was sent out with no setup. You can’t unbox something this size, you cut the box away. It took an hour or so to set it up solo and get on it the stand without overstressing the unit. In the end it worked out. Amazon’s scheduled delivery service states the TV is setup on it’s stand and the packaging is removed; it just didn’t happen in this case.

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Great TV. Heavier than I expected but it IS ...
review_detail.content: Great TV. Heavier than I expected but it IS a 55". Great picture quality and great features. The only gripe I have, which others may have mentioned is the power cord. Samsung what are you doing? The power cord is shorter then most cords AND with their wire management system it's impossible to use if you don't have an outlet directly behind the TV. Great for wall-mounting but most TVs sit on a stand. We had to opt not to use their wire management built in. Our TV is going on a swivel stand but even still, the cord is going to be shorter then it needs to be. Big downfall there on Samsungs part with the short cord. I'm not taking a star off for that but heads up folks. Still an awesome TV and i'd buy it again. The remote is interesting. I have the best/smartest Harmony remote already but am simplifying things and planning to just use their One Remote. I wish they added a few more buttons on the remote for cable boxes (GUIDE BUTTON!) but it's sleek/small and does the job. Still sucks having to use a cable box remote for a GUIDE button though.

review_detail.author: Rodney Brown
review_detail.title: Very pleased with this Sony TV
review_detail.content: I am very pleased with this Sony TV. It has a nice bright and clear picture. Computerized electronic devices are getting smarter, but my brain is shrinking. Our TV died, so we ordered thus one from Amazon. It arrived in a week (🙂). Opened the box and hauled out the "Quick Start" guide. That turned out to be a couple of sheets of diagrams that were drawn by a crazed engineer, so were discarded. I did manage to screw on the feet, locate the HDMI ports and "audio out" port so that I could hook up my cable Tivo box, Apple TV box, Amazon Fire TV box, Blu-ray DVD player, and my external speakers. Turned the TV on and all I got was a message that said "checking for updates" and a spinning circle. After 45 minutes I turned the TV off and back on and then it let me set up the TV. Wanted to make some settings changes to the TV and it took FOREVER to locate the "Settings' menu, which was cleverly located in a very inconspicuous place. Had to enter passwords for Netflix and Amazon Prime. Tried to get cable Tivo controller to control TV functions, but had to give up and get our local cable tech to do it. He did it in about 30 seconds. The Mariners game on Wednesday was going to be broadcast only on Facebook, so I had to download the Facebook app. Once I downloaded it, it took me forever to locate it on my Amazon Fire TV  Home screen. After 4 days of frustration, lots of Googling, and much stress, everything seems to be working properly. I need to get one of our kids or grandkids to live with us permanently to deal with all of these "smart" electronic devices.

Product: Sony XBR55X900F 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.content: Really enjoy the great video on the TV. Great color and handles motion well. Works great with Apple TV and watching movies in HDR. Set up was pretty easy. Use a sound bar, so have not evaluated the sound. Very satisfied. Packed very well for delivery.

I had a huge smile on my face, I'm gonna start doing some calibrations to really have this tv show me what it can do. Compared to the x900e the improvement isn't that much noticeable to me (you videophiles are welcomed to prove me wrong) so if Dolby Vision (future update) isn't something you really need, go ahead with the x900e as the current prices on it are really good, you will not be disappointed. I do highly recommend the 2018 set though.

Product: Sony XBR55X900F 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Jaxsun
review_detail.title: Picture is not great on my set
review_detail.content: I did a lot of research and ended up with the x900f 65 totally based on all the great reviews.  After a week, I am very disappointed.  When it switches between scenes, or switching from a commercial back to live, the colors and brightness change all over the place.  Watching golf, a guy on the green putting from some distance away appears distorted - face is smeared out.  A minute later, on a close up, the face is clear as can be.  I don't think it's the camera man. I've tried running hdmi straight from my xfinity x1 box to IN-2 and IN-3 to eliminate my AVR.  I tried eliminating xfinity as well by going to Prime and watching Star Trek Beyond allegedly in 4K.  (In these apps, the Display doesn't show what resolution you are getting).  I watched simultaneously with my 8 year old Panasonic 3d tv and x900f was only slightly better.  I have tweaked all the settings using rtings recommendations.  These settings produce an overblown vivid color rendition that is unacceptable.  As to other questions:  Does x900f upscale to 4K automatically?  If so, Display only shows a resolution of 1080.  Is that correct?  When I go to the Action Menu and to Picture settings, there is a pause of 5 to 10 seconds before the sub menu appears on the right side of the screen.  Took me awhile to wait it out.  Either I have a bad tv or ...?  Unless I can get it improved, I am going to have to return it.  Anybody have any ideas?

review_detail.author: Hi!
review_detail.title: 5 stars.
review_detail.content: The Sony x900f is a great TV. With the new X1 extreme chip inside of it this year  handles 4k content amazingly, and upscales cable and 1080p content to near 4k quality. Deep blacks and beautiful colors. I also own a Sony x930e the baby Z9D. and this tv comes close to that. Just not as bright. Full-array local-dimming is the way to go these days. PlayStation 4 Pro looks amazing on this TV the way the X1 extreme chip boosts the 4k and HDR to native 4k is flawless... I used to own the Sony x900e took it back for the 930e. This TV is slightly better than the 900e because of the X1 extreme chipset . The Android operating system runs a lot faster and smoother. All in all you cannot go wrong with Sony. I'm very happy with the tv. And I do recommend this year's 900 series. I'm loving my Sony Tv's. Next purchase surround sound!!!

review_detail.author: Jim
review_detail.title: My UN55NU8000 has a Beautiful Picture but has a Sound Problem
review_detail.content: I ordered it on Monday and it was delivered on Wednesday. I mounted it on my new stand and was watching it that afternoon. I am not very technically oriented and have not yet managed to completely set it up and that may be part of my problem in selecting what I want to use as the input but eventually, I manage to get see my computer or Hard Disk Players, but it usually takes me a while to manage that. Like I said, the picture is beautiful but the second day, the sound from my Speaker System suddenly started sounding sort of like a studdering. This happened while I was playing a recorded program from my HDD player. I stopped the playback and then restarted it and the sound was all right again. This has happened a number of times since then. Earlier today I was watching an over the air broadcast and for the first time, the OTA sound started the studdering and in order to get it to stop, I had to turn off the channel and then go back to it. I am old and I wear hearing aids in both ears so what I hear may not sound too me like it would to someone else. The fact that I have been unable to completely set up the NU8000 could possibly be part of the problem, however, having read the reviews, quite a few of them mention a sound coming from their NU8000's also. I have previously bought seven Samsung TV,s, this one being number eight and there had never been a problem with any of the previous seven.

review_detail.author: koolkat
review_detail.title: Very pleased so far
review_detail.content: After making  a couple of initial changes in the picture settings we are loving the quality picture this tv produces.  At first though, right out the box and turned on, the picture quality was not at all what I'd expected from a 4k UHD TV.  We were upgrading from a 50inch 1080 LG that was great except the fact that it frizzled out ( black screen) only after 3 years, due to this we decided not to purchase another LG TV and went with Samsung.  At 1st the picture had that classic "soap opera effect"  happening and because of this I was initially disappointed in t he TV, but after messing around with the settings and reading online briefly, I realized it was a feature ( Auto motion plus ) that I can turn off and on, and as soon as I turned it off the picture looked great it was back to a "normal" view and the clarity was noticeable.  When I turned on the HDR feature enhanced the colors and bumped the picture quality up to great.

Product: Samsung Electronics UN65MU6300 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: josh Daniel grant porter
review_detail.title: Amazing tv for the price! Full of features!
review_detail.content: Amazing quilty of picture I really like the built in apps that output at 4K. Simply amazing. I read some reviews about how there are ads in the menu and people gave it a really love review because of this. I was willing to compromise for the price. While I was setting it up it showed me terms of the voice control and the ad terms people were speaking of. I agreeed to all the terms but the ads and no ads on my menu! There is a button that says agree to all. Just highlight the terms you agree to and press continue.all the apps are great quick processing between apps. One feature I was not aware of was the Bluetooth pairing right to my sound bar! Or Bluetooth headphone whatever works for you. This is a huge upgrade from my last hd tv. The jump from 1080p to 4K uhd is miles. If you are contemplating upgrading to a 4 k tv and your on a budget get this tv ASAP. Plus I got a option to pay monthly in 5 payments super good deal! Hope this helps

Product: Samsung Electronics UN65MU6300 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: D. Fox
review_detail.title: Great TV With Problems Added By Samsung And Others
review_detail.content: I gave 3 stars but want you to know this TV has a great picture and apps to go with it... rating it low because I want people to know some things that are just not right.  One thing is Samsung asks you to agree to a lot of stuff when you set this TV up and I did not agree to any of it.  Agreeing to it means the TV can record, store, and send to Samsung a lot of what you do and say in your house...  That is just wrong.... companies today are very over reaching with what they are doing... another thing I found out when I started the YouTube app... it gave me a code which I needed to enter in a webpage with  my computer.. after several times trying, it would not activate YouTube... I was using Internet Explorer and finally decided to use Chrome and it activated right away... I was about ready to pack the TV up and send it back to Amazon.. this is not a TV problem but a Google problem and a lot of people will think something is wrong with the TV causing a return to Amazon...

Product: Samsung Electronics UN65MU6300 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Matthew Fisch
review_detail.title: Software Update Ruined TV
review_detail.content: I've had this TV for a few days now, and I don't have any complaints with it. I also have a 65 inch Sony Bravia, and I prefer the Samsung for a number of reasons. First and foremost, using bluetooth to listen to the TV through wireless headphones is a priority for me. This isn't possible with the Sony model I have, whereas the Samsung seamlessly connects to most of the headphones I own. The picture is magnificent, and the interface is easy to operate. There are 4 different picture settings, and it's important to adjust them based on what you are watching. Sports and movies look quite different in each of the modes. The remote is very basic and straightforward, and is the opposite of the Sony remote. It was easy to pair this TV with my DirecTV remote, so I have more flexibility in controlling the TV that way. The TV was also easy to unpack and mount. Overall, I don't have any complaints with this TV. At the price I paid for it, it's a bargain.

Product: Samsung Electronics UN65MU6300 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

Cannot even tell if there has been any delay in the image. I put this one in the newly renovated gameroom in the basement. Just an incredible TV for the price!

Product: Samsung Electronics UN65MU6300 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: blumonk
review_detail.title: A Great Product
review_detail.content: Our last Samsung HDTV was nearly 10 years old when it died (ongoing fan problems too pricy to fix).  After reading many reviews of 2016/2017 40-44 inch models, we decided on Samsung once again (we've had about 3 months).  So far so good. It arrived in a well-designed, protective box that was easy to maneuver. I removed the TV from the box without a hitch and began to get it operational.  It went flawlessly.  Straight-forward instructions (e-owners manual online and other onscreen insturctions) allowed for an easy flow from the box to watching our first program. It took 3 days for me to get it fully operational but one could do it faster.  I just decided on the steps I wanted to follow and all went well.  We were watching cable tv the first day, the APPS came the second day and full connections to accessories (sound bar, Amazon Fire-Stick, and DVD player) the third day.  The picture took a bit of tweaking and is really a matter of personal preference. I simply followed onscreen instructions until we found the adjustments we liked.  I believe we now have the best picture on a TV we've ever had. It seems to be a great product.  Time will tell of course.  4 stars only because it is too new for 5.

review_detail.author: R. Hiltz
review_detail.title: Great Value in a 4K Entry Level HDTV
review_detail.content: Great 4K TV (especially at the price point Amazon had this just before Thanksgiving - $445). Setup is pretty easy, a wizard walks you through the process. The TV has some built in intelligence to identify the device at HDMI inputs (3). Sometimes it gets those wrong and I see no way to manually identify the inputs. If you change your HDMI input configuration you can run the setup program again to have the unit rescan and identify the inputs. Supposedly this set is HDR10 compliant, but I noticed when setting my Sony X800 4K player HDMI 1 output to HDR nothing is displayed at the TV. (may need to check HDMI cable version or maybe Sony doesn't play well with Samsung). Overall picture is very good with limited motion blur. Sound is good also. One novel fetaure noted is when turning on, the picture expands from the center and when turning off it collapes to the center of the screen.

review_detail.title: Not bad but has some WiFi issues
review_detail.content: Im reviewing this as a bedroom TV to watch cable and netflix on. I have not gamed on it. Picture is pretty good just dont expect really inky blacks because its an LED not an OLED. There are a lot of picture adjustment options but its decent right out of the box. Speakers are fine and it was easy to mount. So my only grip with this TV is how long it takes to pick up a WiFi signal when you turn it on. When you turn it off, it goes into a sleep mode of sorts so that you can choose to have it power on with your last used app up and ready to go. Problem is, sometimes when you turn it and and try to start playing internet content right away, it will say you have no internet connection. Reason being sometimes it just takes a while to re-connect to your WiFi after being turned off. So the only remedy to this is to just wait until it picks up the signal. My ritual at night is I turn it on, then I brush my teeth so when I come back I know it will be connected and ready to go. I used to try to just turn it on and go right into watching netflix but then it would say "no internet connection" and ask me if I wanted to troubleshoot. I am on the latest firmware update also. This is your warning.

review_detail.content: Wow, we are blown away with this TV we purchased for our bedroom.  Great looking TV when it's off with a super thin/sleek profile.  I can't believe how thin they can make these things.  The picture quality is even more impressive.

The  OTA TV guide is also really nice and responsive. Obviously, the picture is not as good as our Samsung 8 series 65in UHD in the living room, but for our bedroom this is the perfect TV! I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a new TV.

review_detail.content: I got the 55" and I am very impressed with the TV so far. The most surprising thing has to be how low the response time is for gaming, it is significantly more responsive than any of my other TVs, even the small ones.

Product: TCL 65S517 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Robin Ray
review_detail.title: This TV Put A Smile On My Face
review_detail.content: A lot has been written about this TV already so I won't go into the specs but, instead, relate my experience with it. This TV rules. 4K videos look great on it. The audio is loud and rounded enough that I don't need a soundbar. As we speak I'm listening to the greatest hits of No Doubt on it. I spent a lot of time with the different video settings but, really, the default ones suit me fine. When I first turned this unit on the Smoothing effect was on high. I've since turned it off because even on low setting videos look like a soap opera. In my neck of the woods I don't get many over-the-air (OTA) channels and have to settle for just a handful of "old people" stations. The internet connection in my building is relatively weak; however, when it does work well, I can stream movies from VUDU in high definition without much interruptions. I plan to keep this piece of electronica around for a few years. I'd originally bought the 49" inch version but, because my vision is not the greatest in the world, returned it for this 55 incher. Amazon refunded my money for the 49" one rather quickly, too. All in all, one of the best purchases I've made in a long time.

Product: TCL 65S517 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: ABRAHAM D YANG
review_detail.title: Refresh rate CANNOT be turned off. Movies will look like soap opera.
review_detail.content: Let me save you some time and sanity: if you don’t like your movies to look like the news or soap opera, DO NOT BUY this TV. There is no setting for you to turn off the refresh rate. Other than that, there is serious edge light bleed. The picture quality is average. I mean, you get what you pay for, nothing more.

Product: TCL 65S517 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

Especially with Dolby Vision on from Apple TV 4K, picture quality is awesome too when playing 4K movies, I watched several movies that I’ve watched before and then I watched them again in 4K on this TV and I noticed all the details that I’ve missed with 1080P TV. BUT, omg the dirty screen effect is overwhelming! And light leak is pretty bad too, but you won’t notice it unless when ur video is showing majorly white or black scenes.

review_detail.author: koolkat
review_detail.title: Very pleased so far
review_detail.content: After making  a couple of initial changes in the picture settings we are loving the quality picture this tv produces.  At first though, right out the box and turned on, the picture quality was not at all what I'd expected from a 4k UHD TV.  We were upgrading from a 50inch 1080 LG that was great except the fact that it frizzled out ( black screen) only after 3 years, due to this we decided not to purchase another LG TV and went with Samsung.  At 1st the picture had that classic "soap opera effect"  happening and because of this I was initially disappointed in t he TV, but after messing around with the settings and reading online briefly, I realized it was a feature ( Auto motion plus ) that I can turn off and on, and as soon as I turned it off the picture looked great it was back to a "normal" view and the clarity was noticeable.  When I turned on the HDR feature enhanced the colors and bumped the picture quality up to great.

Product: Samsung Electronics UN50MU6300 50-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: josh Daniel grant porter
review_detail.title: Amazing tv for the price! Full of features!
review_detail.content: Amazing quilty of picture I really like the built in apps that output at 4K. Simply amazing. I read some reviews about how there are ads in the menu and people gave it a really love review because of this. I was willing to compromise for the price. While I was setting it up it showed me terms of the voice control and the ad terms people were speaking of. I agreeed to all the terms but the ads and no ads on my menu! There is a button that says agree to all. Just highlight the terms you agree to and press continue.all the apps are great quick processing between apps. One feature I was not aware of was the Bluetooth pairing right to my sound bar! Or Bluetooth headphone whatever works for you. This is a huge upgrade from my last hd tv. The jump from 1080p to 4K uhd is miles. If you are contemplating upgrading to a 4 k tv and your on a budget get this tv ASAP. Plus I got a option to pay monthly in 5 payments super good deal! Hope this helps

Product: Samsung Electronics UN50MU6300 50-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: D. Fox
review_detail.title: Great TV With Problems Added By Samsung And Others
review_detail.content: I gave 3 stars but want you to know this TV has a great picture and apps to go with it... rating it low because I want people to know some things that are just not right.  One thing is Samsung asks you to agree to a lot of stuff when you set this TV up and I did not agree to any of it.  Agreeing to it means the TV can record, store, and send to Samsung a lot of what you do and say in your house...  That is just wrong.... companies today are very over reaching with what they are doing... another thing I found out when I started the YouTube app... it gave me a code which I needed to enter in a webpage with  my computer.. after several times trying, it would not activate YouTube... I was using Internet Explorer and finally decided to use Chrome and it activated right away... I was about ready to pack the TV up and send it back to Amazon.. this is not a TV problem but a Google problem and a lot of people will think something is wrong with the TV causing a return to Amazon...

Product: Samsung Electronics UN50MU6300 50-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Matthew Fisch
review_detail.title: Software Update Ruined TV
review_detail.content: I've had this TV for a few days now, and I don't have any complaints with it. I also have a 65 inch Sony Bravia, and I prefer the Samsung for a number of reasons. First and foremost, using bluetooth to listen to the TV through wireless headphones is a priority for me. This isn't possible with the Sony model I have, whereas the Samsung seamlessly connects to most of the headphones I own. The picture is magnificent, and the interface is easy to operate. There are 4 different picture settings, and it's important to adjust them based on what you are watching. Sports and movies look quite different in each of the modes. The remote is very basic and straightforward, and is the opposite of the Sony remote. It was easy to pair this TV with my DirecTV remote, so I have more flexibility in controlling the TV that way. The TV was also easy to unpack and mount. Overall, I don't have any complaints with this TV. At the price I paid for it, it's a bargain.

Cannot even tell if there has been any delay in the image. I put this one in the newly renovated gameroom in the basement. Just an incredible TV for the price!

review_detail.author: blumonk
review_detail.title: A Great Product
review_detail.content: Our last Samsung HDTV was nearly 10 years old when it died (ongoing fan problems too pricy to fix).  After reading many reviews of 2016/2017 40-44 inch models, we decided on Samsung once again (we've had about 3 months).  So far so good. It arrived in a well-designed, protective box that was easy to maneuver. I removed the TV from the box without a hitch and began to get it operational.  It went flawlessly.  Straight-forward instructions (e-owners manual online and other onscreen insturctions) allowed for an easy flow from the box to watching our first program. It took 3 days for me to get it fully operational but one could do it faster.  I just decided on the steps I wanted to follow and all went well.  We were watching cable tv the first day, the APPS came the second day and full connections to accessories (sound bar, Amazon Fire-Stick, and DVD player) the third day.  The picture took a bit of tweaking and is really a matter of personal preference. I simply followed onscreen instructions until we found the adjustments we liked.  I believe we now have the best picture on a TV we've ever had. It seems to be a great product.  Time will tell of course.  4 stars only because it is too new for 5.

review_detail.title: Great Value in a 4K Entry Level HDTV
review_detail.content: Great 4K TV (especially at the price point Amazon had this just before Thanksgiving - $445). Setup is pretty easy, a wizard walks you through the process. The TV has some built in intelligence to identify the device at HDMI inputs (3). Sometimes it gets those wrong and I see no way to manually identify the inputs. If you change your HDMI input configuration you can run the setup program again to have the unit rescan and identify the inputs. Supposedly this set is HDR10 compliant, but I noticed when setting my Sony X800 4K player HDMI 1 output to HDR nothing is displayed at the TV. (may need to check HDMI cable version or maybe Sony doesn't play well with Samsung). Overall picture is very good with limited motion blur. Sound is good also. One novel fetaure noted is when turning on, the picture expands from the center and when turning off it collapes to the center of the screen.

review_detail.author: Elizabeth Fancher
review_detail.title: Great TV for the price
review_detail.content: This TV is great, picture quality is great and it just looks nice. We really like that it doesn’t rely on WiFi but you can use it I believe. The only things we don’t like is that the apps are limited (we can’t figure out how to add more at least but I just set my Steam link up and use my computer for anything else) and to access the apps (unless you’re switching to YouTube or Netflix, those you get buttons for) you press the home button which means when you’re in an app you have to exit to home, then press home again which is completely unnecessary, every smart TV remote should have a app button. We even looked at the manual to make sure we didn’t miss a button. BUT for how much we paid we’re pleased and only took off a star for the inability to add apps.

review_detail.author: Mariola A.
review_detail.title: Not worth the hassle
review_detail.content: The TV shuts itself off and the only way to restart it is to unplug everything and plug it back in. It keeps happening though sometimes every minute, other times it is on for a whole 20 minutes. Yay! Spoke to Sony Tech support, did the software upgrade and it still didn't work.  Sony solution was that their engineers will call me within 3 business days (there is a weekend in between those days) to do the additional troubleshooting and I should wait by the TV in case they do call. When I asked if I should take three days off from work to wait for them to call me back they confirmed with all the seriousness. They do not have solution for this issue. Amazon was great in sending someone back to pickup this TV.

Product: Sony KD49X720E 49-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Tom Gleason
review_detail.title: Great picture! YouTube 4K content looks excellent on most ...
review_detail.content: Great picture! YouTube 4K content looks excellent on most posted 4K Ultra and HDR videos. The problemed videos I chalk up to bad compression by the poster. The default sound settings require tweaking for excellent TV sound from the set. Most will just add full surround sound externally. It is not a full Android TV (Smart TV) version and there are some limitations but most of the big name streaming services are available. There is currently no full function browser, but I'd say it is plenty functional for most. I did not want integrated Android TV as I prefer to use external Android TV boxes that meet my own hardware specs and allows for Android version upgrades. Currently, I run nVidia Shield and H96 Pro external boxes with excellent streaming results and picture quality.

Product: Sony KD49X720E 49-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Marion Jack RIckard
review_detail.title: Well I bought this TV on March 14. THe ...
review_detail.content: Well I bought this TV on March 14.  THe return window closed on April 13.  And the support window closed on May 13.  And on May 15 the screen started blacking out.  It works normally for a few minutes, then the screen goes black for 1 second and then comes back on  10 seconds later it goes black for one second and immediatly comes back on.  And this continues.  All channels.  All HDMI inputs.  Even Internet Amazon Video or YouTube.

Product: Sony KD49X720E 49-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Divine.
review_detail.title: Not Worth The Money
review_detail.content: I am truly unimpressed with this TV. The picture isn't all that wonderful, barely an upgrade from the my previous basic off-brand TV. Not to mention, the volume is ridiculously low. I have to crank it up to 60+ to be able to hear it halfway decently. Furthermore, the TV arrived without the required screws to secure it to the base and Sony was of no help. review_detail.author: Deborah Zimmerman
review_detail.title: DONT Buy if you are using Hulu Live streaming service or any other live streaming app
review_detail.content: I was so excited to get this TV. We just cut the cable cord and moved to Hulu for live streaming TV so I thought a smart TV would be convenient for kitchen. The Smartcast platform has apps pre-loaded like Hulu and these apps cannot be changed out. So if you are using a streaming app that streams live TV like Hulu or Sling, the only way you can stream is to use a secondary device like your mobile phone or a table and utilize the smartcast application that pairs the devices with the Smartcast TV. Here's the conversation with the Vizio tech support : "The Hulu live services are not included in the smartcast version of the app unfortunately. The TV by design is a Smartcast TV. The on board apps are only an alternative. Similar to a Google Chromecast it's primary use is casting content. " Me: "Wow  that is a huge flaw and renders this TV obsolete for our household "  His advice: "What others tend to do if it helps is use a low cost tablet that runs Android as a "remote" type of setup so there is always a device to cast from for apps that may not be on board or have different functions."

Product: VIZIO SmartCast D-series 24” Class Full HD 1080p LED Smart TV

review_detail.author: Amzcust22
review_detail.title: Prime Video is not functional
review_detail.content: The Prime Video app does not work.  While the previews play fine, this is displayed: "We're unable to play your video at this time. Please try again in a few minutes or contact Amazon Customer Service...". This message alternates between "Insufficient bandwidth available, do you want to continue playback?", but never displays anything. The previews of shows play correctly, but not the shows themselves. This "bandwidth" message is a red herring, I can play back HD video just fine on a number of devices from a number of providers, including Prime Video on a 1st gen Fire Stick which I now use for the TV. I have a 25+Mbps connection, verified on the test connection on the TV itself as well as my other devices. I also tried very low BW SD content, and a wired connection for kicks.

review_detail.author: Michael G.
review_detail.title: Awful UI
review_detail.content: I wanted to craft an articulate rant about this waste of landfill space and sweatshop labor but instead I’ll put in the same amount of effort that went into Vizio Smartcast. Windows 8 is more intuitive, the broken self-checkout at your local Walmart is DeepMind in comparison. It feels like it should be a trial version of the bloatware that comes with a new pc but nope, that’s it. You have to use your phone to mirror apps to the tv you can’t add anymore than what’s included. If you’re going to make something integral and nearly unavoidable in your product it has to be excellent and this ain’t it. As a side note there’s no way to block content or parental controls if you’re getting it for a kid’s room. Superbad was a good movie but it shouldn’t be a banner ad that my 7 yr old could click on.

The good news is that it has a good picture but the bad news is that after a few months the picture began to feeze periodically - sound still plays, but picture sits still.  You have to power off and be patient as it takes about 30-60 seconds to shut down and power up again.  This happens about 2x per day.  The other bad news is that the sound is tinny and remote is cheap and flimsy. Moral here is that you get what you pay for so I will stick with Sony or Samsung next time.

Not an Android TV but comes loaded with the typical apps. Best WiFi of any TV I've tried, which is a step up for Sony. Very stable connection to my network and NAS media server.

Product: Sony KDL32W600D 32-Inch HD Smart TV (2016 Model)

review_detail.author: Taminator
review_detail.title: Occasional streaming issues with YouTube only
review_detail.content: I've had the TV for about 6 weeks and I'm having an issue with steaming YouTube occasionally.  It's happened three times so far where the video stream just get's choked up and stalls/freezes. In order to get it to work again I have to turn off the surge protector (same as unplugging it from the wall) as simply restarting the TV doesn't resolve the issue. This issue does not happen with NetFlix on the TV so it's YouTube specific in my case...  This TV's wireless connection seems to have an issue with YouTube about every 7-10 days so far. Otherwise I'm happy with the TV, the price was a deal and I have always been a Sony fan. And I do not have CATV so I can't speak to how the TV performs when it's not streaming. I've read other reviews where people are having to unplug this TV in order to solve issues so if you can't easily get to your wall outlet or surge protector I would recommend another model. Also the sound on this TV isn't the greatest so if you're looking for great sound get some external speakers or buy another TV. I have a surround sound system so if the sound on this TV is really falling short for what I want to watch I can always connect that.

Product: Sony KDL32W600D 32-Inch HD Smart TV (2016 Model)

review_detail.author: Lidson
review_detail.title: So far so good
review_detail.content: So far so good. The set up was easy (skipped the auto set up because I have an HDMI cable box and just selected the input). The picture quality is great. It has more screen space than my old sony bravia. The sound is definitely different. It's about as loud on 50 as my old tv was on 30, which is okay because it's in a bedroom. The sound quality is good. It does sound like it is coming from the tv and not bouncing off the wall behind it like some very thin tvs. Overall I like it. Also it has the turn on timer function which I love because I use my tv as an alarm clock.

review_detail.content: The tv has a good picture and sound for the price.  However, at first the remote for this unit only worked if I held it 1 foot away from the screen.  Samsung customer service recommended new batteries but that did not fix the problem.  As a result, I was not able to do the initial set up for the tv properly, because at first I couldn't get the remote to work properly.  This was very frustrating.  I fixed the problem by raising the tv from the base a little bit so the remote signal receiver on the TV, located at the bottom center, was not blocked.  Then, when the tv is turned on, I got a Netflix ad that runs for a few seconds.  I was able to turn this ad off by going to the setup menu; but it was annoying at first.  After I got these issues fixed, I would now buy this television again from this vendor.

review_detail.author: Lottie
review_detail.title: For the money, this is a terrific TV and easy to install.
review_detail.content: OK so full disclosure, I was really annoyed because this was supposed to be delivered on Sunday and it finally arrived Wednesday late day,  after 45 minutes on line that day to cancel the order. It did finally arrive and I have to say, I am pretty good with technology but any novice can install this in minutes. I bought it because the Netflix app was already loaded so no fire stick needed. I did have to load my Netflix account info twice but, honestly this is a terrific product for the money. I know the sound isn’t fabulous and attaching speakers would make this really good, but I just wanted it for my bedroom tv before I fall asleep. If you just want a good quality tv without working so hard to have a great picture, this is for you.

Product: Sony KDL32W600D 32-Inch HD Smart TV (2016 Model)

review_detail.author: Mrs. Dubyah
review_detail.title: FAILED LESS THAN YEAR LATER
review_detail.content: Bought the TV in March 2017.  It worked fine until February 2018 when the picture suddenly stopped working.  After working with the Sony Support Chat representative, I still was unable to get the picture back.  Their final recommendation was to take it to the nearest Sony service center--many hours drive away from my home.  I do not plan to do that as the distance is too great plus I am fairly certain there will be a significant charge for that service--not worth it.  I am very discouraged about the quality of merchandise nowadays--what a disposable society we live in.

The colors are brighter and the contrast is perfect for a computer screen. Glad so far that I bought it. As I love long term updates on items, I'm sure I will be updating after around 6 mos or so.

Product: VIZIO 32" 1080p Smart LED TV D32X-D1 (2016)

review_detail.author: Satyaki De
review_detail.title: Vizio,D40u,D1,4K,Ultra,Smart,Tv,
review_detail.content: I must say within this price range this TV looks great initially. And, also you'll get some technical support in Amazon by fellow members. With their guidance you'll definitely get a good picture quality as well. And, you will have decent colour tone & balance, which is important for me. As a photographer, I always provide close attention to these details. However, this TV started to loose it's charm within a year. It has some blur issue in case of to much movement for few videos. And, now & then this Tv frequently get hang & need to force restart. Also, the number of apps are extremely limited as you don't have google play in it. Recently, they have added google play movie only. Hence, you cannot add popular app like Sling, which you have to do via chrome cast. Though 4K videos are really impressive & I tested that in Netflix. Sound are ok as I use external speaker for that. So, for me sound is not a big issue. And, this model doesn't have any blue tooth feature. So, you cannot add any device, which has blue tooth. Considering these limitations - I would stick to 3. Hope, this review will help other prospective clients to make-up their mind.

Product: VIZIO 32" 1080p Smart LED TV D32X-D1 (2016)

review_detail.author: Kindle Customer
review_detail.title: I chose this model because we wanted to watch kodi streamed movies and its operating system does not complain like the Tizen system
review_detail.content: Purchased Aug 2,2016 and set it up in our bedroom. We have had many tvs including led and fluorescent lit and hi end brands. I chose this model because we wanted to watch kodi streamed movies and its operating system does not complain like the Tizen system. I have to admit that I was expecting a mediocre to good picture but was very surprised by a full-featured image quality that goes beyond the price category. Color saturation and accuracy is excellent as well as black levels with excellent contrast. I forgot what I tuned the picture to but I have been tested for my work as having color vision in the upper 2% of the population and this tv is right on. I have always thought the Vizio marketing model was practical but never expected this quality. Do not hesitate to go for a Vizio. I have always trusted Amazon as well and buying this tv from them was a good choice as they do back up the purchase. I have to admit that I did compare tvs at a box store to prevent surprises.

review_detail.author: Cliff Weed
review_detail.title: TV is fine, delivery is questionable.
review_detail.content: It actually makes the 65” TVs next to it look small. Picture is great, smart remote is kinda dumb though. The biggest problem was delivery. There’s three options when you order a large TV, leave it at the door, bring it in the room, and third set it up and remove the packing. The problem is you never know ahead of time what’s coming. The TV took 2 weeks to arrive after ordering it; half of that time it was sitting on the loading dock of the local trucking company hired to deliver it. A 140 lbs TV was sent out with 2 girls who it outweighed, Had I not helped them, they would have never got the TV in the elevator; some fancy 3 plane manipulation was required. They were only a delivery service, an 82” TV was sent out with no setup. You can’t unbox something this size, you cut the box away. It took an hour or so to set it up solo and get on it the stand without overstressing the unit. In the end it worked out. Amazon’s scheduled delivery service states the TV is setup on it’s stand and the packaging is removed; it just didn’t happen in this case.

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Great TV. Heavier than I expected but it IS ...
review_detail.content: Great TV. Heavier than I expected but it IS a 55". Great picture quality and great features. The only gripe I have, which others may have mentioned is the power cord. Samsung what are you doing? The power cord is shorter then most cords AND with their wire management system it's impossible to use if you don't have an outlet directly behind the TV. Great for wall-mounting but most TVs sit on a stand. We had to opt not to use their wire management built in. Our TV is going on a swivel stand but even still, the cord is going to be shorter then it needs to be. Big downfall there on Samsungs part with the short cord. I'm not taking a star off for that but heads up folks. Still an awesome TV and i'd buy it again. The remote is interesting. I have the best/smartest Harmony remote already but am simplifying things and planning to just use their One Remote. I wish they added a few more buttons on the remote for cable boxes (GUIDE BUTTON!) but it's sleek/small and does the job. Still sucks having to use a cable box remote for a GUIDE button though.

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Best TV I've ever had
review_detail.content: I have never owned a TCL before and was hesitant to stray from the usual name brands but this TV is more than worth the price. If this is what TCL is producing, then I'll be sticking with TCL from now on. There are only two issues I have with the picture quality and that is the banding that results from the back lighting, and a halo effect that is produced under certain conditions, from the local dimming. But, for the price, these are very minor complaints and are outweighed by the sheer quality of this thing. The feet are solid and made of metal and the case is metal and has a great finish. The picture this TV produces is incredible and as close to OLED as I've seen from a non-OLED set. It is more than bright enough for any environment, has incredible color, and great local dimming. Very pleased and would strongly recommend to anyone.

Product: TCL 65R617 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Dedicated Follower of Ray
review_detail.title: Excellent value, love the Roku operating system.
review_detail.content: I was contemplating an LG OLED but couldn't justify the price.  I read a lot about the quality control issues of this model and I seem to have lucked out with a good panel.  Coming from a 10 year-old 46" Panasonic plasma, I'm blown away by the immersive feel and amazing picture of this TCL.  I also love the Roku operating system, which is simple and logical.  I've had a Roku device for a long time, so I was right at home.  I also like the small Roku remote, which I prefer to the "spaceship" remotes of other brands.  Set up was simple.  I honestly believe is Apple made a TV, it would be like this TCL.  Simple, intuitive, and everything you need and nothing you don't.  My only beef is that there are only three HDMI inputs, but I knew that going in.  That said, the built-in Roku means I don't have to use an HDMI to hook up a Roku box, so that sort of makes up for it.  Maybe TCL has improved their quality control, but so far I am satisfied.  Beware that if you buy this TV at Best Buy, you get an inferior remote that does not work with voice commands.  The version of the TV sold by Amazon comes with the superior remote.  Delivery was professional and as promised, and I was even able to move it up a few days after I originally scheduled it.

Product: TCL 65R617 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: John C
review_detail.title: Great TV, unbeatable price.
review_detail.content: Great TV, unbeatable price.

Product: TCL 65R617 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: justmytwocents
review_detail.title: Possible Vizio killer?  TCL with Roku is almost perfect
review_detail.content: Since we ditched the satellite, almost all TV we watch is using a Roku.  So, when the bedroom TV gave up the ghost, we thought this was a natural choice.  It was a little pricey, but has the 4K HDR, and we already new we would appreciate that, having a Vizio in the living room with the same features.  The Vizio gives us problems showing the HDR from the Roku, but having Roku integrated into this TCL means there are no problems at all.  Much prefer it to the Smartcast feature in the Vizio.  One little thing bugs me about this TV.  Plugging anything into the headphone jack mutes the sound, even if there is no headphone attached.  Other TVs only mute if there is a headphone to complete the circuit.  This means I can't use my wireless headphones, because when the base station is plugged in, the TV mutes itself.  Most other TVs you can leave the base station plugged in, and the TV only mutes when the headphones are in use.  Yes, I can use headphones plugged into the remote or into my smart phone with the app, but the sound quality is terrible compared to the sound I get with the Sennheiser wireless headphones.  I should also mention that the carton the TV came in was in rough shape, as others have mentioned, but luckily the TV itself is fine, having survived the trip with nary a scratch.  Overall, this TV is an excellent value at this price, and it is hard to imagine anyone being unhappy with it as long as it is working and is reliable long-term.  So, unless or until it breaks, it gets five stars.

Product: TCL 65R617 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

Product: TCL 65R617 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Eric
review_detail.title: This is an amazing TV, especially for the price
review_detail.content: This is an amazing TV, especially for the price, and I couldn't be happier with it. I also own a LG 55 B6P OLED which cost me $2,000, and the picture quality between this TV and that one honestly doesn't justify the price disparity unless you're an enthusiast and REALLY picky. The amount of features TCL packed into this TV for the price is nothing short of impressive. I've not noticed any defects or quality control issues on my set, but other reviewers have, so I recommend paying very close attention the first few days to check for any manufacturers' defects. There were no dead pixels or banding issues on my screen. The only negative aspect of the TV which I noticed is the screen uniformity. When you display a solid color image you notice that the corners are slightly dimmer than the center of the screen. This is not noticeable under normal viewing conditions but it is noticeable if you run a screen test that displays solid colors, which I recommend everyone does. The good things about this TV far outweigh the bad, and you can't expect perfection at this price range. I think any casual viewer, Netflix user, Youtube watcher and/or console gamer will be very pleased with this TV. TCL did an amazing job and deserve praise for this model.

review_detail.author: BigB
review_detail.title: Awesome value! Very Happy!
review_detail.content: I’m very happy with the TV. I originally looked at the entry level model at Costco. Even that model had a better image than other well known brands in the isle. The only thing that looked cheap was the frame and logo. I decided to go with the 55” 517 model from Amazon which has a thinner bezel and the TCL logo is nicer. The panel is a step up as well. The picture is incredible! Roku works well and my wife is enjoying the channels. I connected the HDMI ARC port to my new Samsung Sound Bar’s ARC and can control the sound from the cable remote without any further configuration. The sound turns on and off with the TV. I also added Bias lighting to the rear. The only drawback is that the USB port powering the bias lighting takes 15min to go off after the TV is put in standby. The bottom of the TV has a deeper depth than the top, which is very thin. This left room me to mount and hide my cable box behind the TV on the upper left side. Overall this TV is an awesome value. The quality is equal to or better than others and at a better price point.

review_detail.author: Andres Camarena
review_detail.title: Great for console and online gaming
review_detail.content: I wanted a display that could get HDR out of my PS4 Pro and that could be used for online gaming. Setting it up was easy and it works flawlessly with my PS4 Pro. Getting the optimum resolution and framerate was slightly annoying when mirroring my laptop (it was displaying 4k at 30 Hz and I wanted 60 Hz). An article had a series of steps that worked for me. On the TV I manually changed the HDMI inputs to 2.0, restarted the TV in settings, and then I went to the NVIDIA control panel on my laptop to change to 4k at 60 Hz. Playing Overwatch on this display (through HDMI connection from my laptop) was just as comfortable as playing from my laptop directly. It's done everything I've wanted and the price was great. I very highly recommend.

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: Very good picture and great Roku OS, but finding a mount was really hard.  Not as easy as just finding a VESA 200x200
review_detail.content: [Updated May 18, 2018]  Awesome Roku operating system.  The picture is very good but took forever to get the picture just the way I wanted it.  If you get the skin tones the way you want it, then some reds are off.  If you get the reds good, then the greens are off, and so on...... So unless you spend a lot of time working on the settings, you will have a compromise.  I spent the time and the picture looks very good now.  You also need to configure the picture for each input source, which means you are going to spend the better part of a day to get everything perfect - or at least perfect for now.  Time will tell.  In comparison to my Samsung UN65JU7100FXZA, which is now about 3yrs old, the Samsung has a better picture right out of the box and no matter how hard you try, you cannot get the TCL to look as good.  It is worth noting that the 3yr old Samsung still costs twice as much new if you can find it.  Overall, you can't beat the value of the TCL 517.  I paid with my Amazon Prime Visa, which got me 5% back and the 4yr warranty was under $25.  I don't normally buy extended warranties, but for $25, why not.

review_detail.author: Joseph M.
review_detail.title: I've bought Sony, and Samsung, and Vizio, all were very good, and the LG is joining them.
review_detail.content: The LG replaced one of the best TV's I ever had. I had a 15 year old Samsung DLP, but not just a DLP, it was the best DLP ever made. No light bulbs, no spinning mirrors, no moving parts. After 12 or 13 years, it started getting white spots, so I  replaced the DLP chip myself and it was great again until the remote, and switches would not respond, So in comes the 65" LG, this is the biggest I've bought so far, the others were 62", and a little smaller. This one is big in the bedroom, it's like being at a drive-in. The color is good, nothing blares out to me in the picture that I could complain about. I should tell you that I know  what a good picture should look like, and there are a lot of bad TV out there. The LG has a setup that it takes you through to set it up, that was OK.  I got rid of DirecTV, and use DirecTVNow through a 4k FireTV box, and it works really well, and cut my TV bill by 75% . You do have to have Internet to get DirecTVNow, it is a streaming service, but it works really well for me. They gave me 125 channels, and HBO for $55 a month, plus I can record.  It's all new, and so far, so good. The LG looked really good on my FireTV, and  DirecTVNow, which is an app on the FireTV.  I did buy a sound bar with a floor standing woofer, but to be honest, the LG was the first really flat Tv to have decent sound. The sound bar and woofer were a bit better, but not so much that I would cry if I didn't have it. It was a Vizio soundbar I bought in a local club store. The TV box came double boxed by Fedex, and the Fedex guy brought it inside, but wanted to leave it outside and make me bring it in. The TV is light, and you have to put legs on it. each leg takes three screws, and they are labeled A and B, so pay attention, or the Tv might be tipsy on you if you put them on backwards.  This TV was bought with a 4 year warranty, yes, it cost a little more, but read the details,  they fix it in your home, and if they can't fix it they refund your money, how can you beat that. I keep all my electronics on a UPS  battery backup. I live in the lightning belt, and lightening will kill a TV, and many other electronics things very easily. Worse than that, it can cause a hard to find problem, one that many TV repair shops might have trouble fixing. It can even cause multiple problems, making it even harder to fix. I have been on UPS battery backup for 20 years, and yes , I have to replace batteries, and and in some cases I had to replace the UPS, that is way better than having all sorts of problems with my TV's, and other electronics stuff. This LG Tv is a bargain, it is a 2018 model, and supports Google Home, and Amazon Alesis . It has bluetooth to connect to a  bluetooth sound bar.. So let me share my experience in the local club store when I bought the sound bar.  I asked if any of them come with wire connections to the TV , as well as Bluetooth.  I worked in electronics my whole life, and I would rather use wire. In any case, he said no, they all use bluetooth, no wire. So I get it home and open the box and there is an optical cable, a 3,5mm cable, and one other cable, so there was 4 ways to connect that sound bar to my TV, not just Bluetooth. So  I used the Toslink optical cable to connect the sound bar, but now, about the TV and the sound bar. I had the center channel working on the optical cable, and before that I had it on the 3.5mm wire to my cell phone to hear what it sounded like. When the TV came on it dropped the woofer, which does connect with Bluetooth to the sound bar.  So I turned the TV off, and back on, and that was all it needed,  all the sound came on as it should. No hassle, it just did its thing and worked. Their are a lot of apps in this TV, so if you are not fortunate enough to have FireTv with a Prime account, which is awesome, and I highly recommend it, the Tv has a lot of other streaming services built into it.  One of them is Amazon, but that way of getting Amazon content, in no way compares to FireTV, but there are many other apps also.. You can also plus a USB thumb drive , or maybe even a usb hard drive into the back of the TV and watch video, pictures and music from it, It works really well. Then there are plenty of HDMI connectors, although I only needed one.  The remote does leave a little room to complain, the buttons could have been bigger, especially the ones you would use in the dark. Ok, I can replace the remote with a programmable touch screen, but why should i need to do that? Are you reading this LG, get with it , make a great remote for this great TV.  You should be able to get 12 to 14, or more feet from a screen this big,  Some people get lemons, some people don't know what a good picture is, and some people just like to complain, try to know the difference when you read reviews.

There’s three options when you order a large TV, leave it at the door, bring it in the room, and third set it up and remove the packing. The problem is you never know ahead of time what’s coming. The TV took 2 weeks to arrive after ordering it; half of that time it was sitting on the loading dock of the local trucking company hired to deliver it. A 140 lbs TV was sent out with 2 girls who it outweighed, Had I not helped them, they would have never got the TV in the elevator; some fancy 3 plane manipulation was required. They were only a delivery service, an 82” TV was sent out with no setup. You can’t unbox something this size, you cut the box away. It took an hour or so to set it up solo and get on it the stand without overstressing the unit. In the end it worked out. Amazon’s scheduled delivery service states the TV is setup on it’s stand and the packaging is removed; it just didn’t happen in this case.

Samsung what are you doing? The power cord is shorter then most cords AND with their wire management system it's impossible to use if you don't have an outlet directly behind the TV. Great for wall-mounting but most TVs sit on a stand. We had to opt not to use their wire management built in. Our TV is going on a swivel stand but even still, the cord is going to be shorter then it needs to be. Big downfall there on Samsungs part with the short cord. I'm not taking a star off for that but heads up folks. Still an awesome TV and i'd buy it again. The remote is interesting. I have the best/smartest Harmony remote already but am simplifying things and planning to just use their One Remote. I wish they added a few more buttons on the remote for cable boxes (GUIDE BUTTON!) but it's sleek/small and does the job. Still sucks having to use a cable box remote for a GUIDE button though.

review_detail.author: Ken
review_detail.title: Very pleased except...
review_detail.content: I loved every single feature about this purchase except for one thing...the power cord is only about 5 feet long and to get a nice clean look on my wall I needed a 6 foot cord. I wanted to put a small piece of trim around the wire running up the wall but I can't. The plug itself is a "block" the size of a pack of cigarettes so the only way to make the cord longer is to extend the end that goes in to the TV. Well, Amazon has 500 different types of extensions but Lg couldn't tell me which one to get. I spent 15.00 (8.00 SHIPPING) on one and of course it didn't fit. MY MESSAGE TO LG IS THIS...offer an extension to customers that need it at a reasonable price!

I determined it needs a new main board.  This reason alone I will probably never buy a LG TV again.  I have 2 other similar size cheap brand TV's that are still working perfect after 4-5 years.  I'm sure I can buy a board for 35 bucks, but what an inconvenience.

review_detail.title: Great picture, not great sound

It has a nice, light profile and minimal footprint. I like the picture which was an improvement on the 6 year old TV that was there before.  My only disappointment is the sound quality. I suppose that the speakers are small out of necessity but the sound is so tinny it makes my iPhone sound great. I tried adjusting the audio settings, but it doesn't seem to make any difference.  I don't know why these manufacturers don't include an audio out jack so they can be connected to external speakers. It would seem a simple thing to do.

review_detail.author: Barron M.
review_detail.title: Amazing deal, arrived like-new
review_detail.content: The tv arrived in one piece and was packaged reasonably well.  I have no complaints whatsoever!  Great picture, clear sound.  It’s an amazing deal considering it is large and 4K.  I highly recommend this television, but be advised that depending on how many hands this box needs to pass through, you might not have the same luck I did.  Be realistic with your packaging expectations, and know that the shippers do what they can with what they are given.  There was a generous amount of thick cell air plastic on each corner that was custom fit to the TV.  The box was much thicker than the TV, allowing extra room if the box got smushed a bit.  You won’t regret this purchase if your delivery drivers can get it there safely.

As a result, I was not able to do the initial set up for the tv properly, because at first I couldn't get the remote to work properly.  This was very frustrating.  I fixed the problem by raising the tv from the base a little bit so the remote signal receiver on the TV, located at the bottom center, was not blocked.  Then, when the tv is turned on, I got a Netflix ad that runs for a few seconds.  I was able to turn this ad off by going to the setup menu; but it was annoying at first.  After I got these issues fixed, I would now buy this television again from this vendor.

review_detail.title: So far so good
review_detail.content: We bought multiples of these to replace outdated TV's in the mid-sized rooms of our Cape Cod B&B.  We chose them on the strength of positive reviews on Amazon.  So far there have been no comments whatsoever from our guests about these units, which indicates to us that they are doing their job as intended.  Had the opposite been true there would have been complaints and critical comments.  So we're satisfied.

review_detail.author: BubbaHoTep
review_detail.title: Not the best for wall-mounting, giant "wall wart" power cord
review_detail.content: Picture quality is good, even from the sides.  Sound is not bad for a small TV.  I would not buy it again because of 2 things, which may or may not be important to you: 1) The coax and HDMI inputs face directly backwards and are not recessed.  No big deal if you use the stand, but if you wall-mount this TV the inputs are useless unless you buy L-shaped adapters.  And 2) it has a giant "wall wart" power supply instead of a regular power cord.  Way too big to hide/conceal behind a wall-mount bracket.

review_detail.author: Robert F
review_detail.title: Works off a 12V battery in a boat or RV with a DC/DC 12V to 19V boost converter
review_detail.content: I'm putting this in my boat for both TV and a computer display (1920x1080p).  This seems to be a good alternative to the 12V TVs that are currently available. The trick is to add a Aweking Waterproof DC/DC 12V Step Up to 19V 4A 76W Voltage Boost Converter Regulator (tv seems to draw only about an amp, so 4A is an overkill).  Time will tell if it will hold up to vibration and moisture.  The display is not the brightest but considering the low power consumption I'm pleased with it.

It also makes an annoying T Mobile kinda sound when you power up or off. CAVEAT: no audio output, not even a headphone jack. You have to listen to those tinny little onboard speakers instead of the nice stereo you just put in your shop, and that ruins your Youtube playlist. More product detail on the page WOULD BE REAL NICE.

review_detail.author: Maurice C. Valley
review_detail.title: I replaced my old 19 inch CRT tv with this one.
review_detail.content: I replaced my old 19 inch CRT tv with this one. The tv stand just slides into the tv requiring no clamps or screws or anything. Once assembled the tv is stable. After plugging in the power cord and the hdmi cable from my cable card equipped Tivo to the tv and turning it on all I got was static on the tv screen and a request to scan for channels by an annoying voice speaking way too fast. After the tv scanned for channels it said it found none. Great. I thought it was going to be easy to set the tv up. I ended up having to call LG user help and the nice person who answered explained that I had to press the input button on the remote and then change the input from the antenna option to the hdmi option. As soon as I did that I had all of my channels. I wish the tv manual had been more specific about that step in setting-up the tv.

review_detail.content: The tv has a good picture and sound for the price.  However, at first the remote for this unit only worked if I held it 1 foot away from the screen.  Samsung customer service recommended new batteries but that did not fix the problem.  As a result, I was not able to do the initial set up for the tv properly, because at first I couldn't get the remote to work properly.  This was very frustrating.  I fixed the problem by raising the tv from the base a little bit so the remote signal receiver on the TV, located at the bottom center, was not blocked.  Then, when the tv is turned on, I got a Netflix ad that runs for a few seconds.  I was able to turn this ad off by going to the setup menu; but it was annoying at first.  After I got these issues fixed, I would now buy this television again from this vendor.

review_detail.author: Jim
review_detail.title: My UN55NU8000 has a Beautiful Picture but has a Sound Problem
review_detail.content: I ordered it on Monday and it was delivered on Wednesday. I mounted it on my new stand and was watching it that afternoon. I am not very technically oriented and have not yet managed to completely set it up and that may be part of my problem in selecting what I want to use as the input but eventually, I manage to get see my computer or Hard Disk Players, but it usually takes me a while to manage that. Like I said, the picture is beautiful but the second day, the sound from my Speaker System suddenly started sounding sort of like a studdering. This happened while I was playing a recorded program from my HDD player. I stopped the playback and then restarted it and the sound was all right again. This has happened a number of times since then. Earlier today I was watching an over the air broadcast and for the first time, the OTA sound started the studdering and in order to get it to stop, I had to turn off the channel and then go back to it. I am old and I wear hearing aids in both ears so what I hear may not sound too me like it would to someone else. The fact that I have been unable to completely set up the NU8000 could possibly be part of the problem, however, having read the reviews, quite a few of them mention a sound coming from their NU8000's also. I have previously bought seven Samsung TV,s, this one being number eight and there had never been a problem with any of the previous seven.

They love to watch movies so, we purchased them a Netflix subscription and now they get to watch their movies in Style.  It has been easy for them to switch back and forth between cable and then to the Smart TV.  My mom loves watching YouTube videos and now she gets to enjoy it on this TV instead of her computer.  Best Anniversary gift ever!

review_detail.author: GTX USER
review_detail.title: Very happy with this purchase!
review_detail.content: This was the first new TV I ever bought. Up until now, it has been hand-me-downs and used TVs for cheap. I was extremely dismayed when the first unit I received was broken. However the return and replacement process was easy, free and only took 2 days before the replacement arrived. It was shipped in the original box which is very well packaged, so I think the first TV was just a fluke. It is a brightly colored TV box though, so the delivery person will probably not leave it at your door. I had to be present for UPS to drop off. But they didn't make me sign anything, so it might be hit or miss in your area. Keep that in mind when ordering.

Product: TCL 49S305 49-Inch 1080p Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Keith B.
review_detail.title: So Far So Good 👍
review_detail.content: Well, it has been running six plus hours a day 4 - 5 nights a week for a while now and although I know other buyers have had issues this TV has been great. Out of the box it was four screws to put on the two reasonably sturdy feet. Connectors for power and HDMI were easily accessible. Setup was confusing at first. This is supposed to primarily be a Roku/streaming TV although it can work just fine with you cable or satellite provider's set top box. Included instructions didn't have a bypass the online setup section but TCL support quickly walked me through getting the TV connected to the cable box. Image quality is stunning. I was honestly amazed at how bright, vibrant and saturated the picture is. Sound quality is good, nothing spectacular but it does go loud which was a necessity as my mother, the primary user, is going deaf and at full volume couldn't hear her previous TV. She hears this set perfectly and there's plenty of volume left if her hearing issues worsen. I would recommend this set to anyone looking for an affordable TV.

I think it's a little small to be great at 8-9 feet away, you lose some detail but not enough for it to be a deal breaker. If there was a 43" version of this, I would probably swap it out.

Product: TCL 49S517 49-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

review_detail.author: Robin Ray
review_detail.title: This TV Put A Smile On My Face
review_detail.content: A lot has been written about this TV already so I won't go into the specs but, instead, relate my experience with it. This TV rules. 4K videos look great on it. The audio is loud and rounded enough that I don't need a soundbar. As we speak I'm listening to the greatest hits of No Doubt on it. I spent a lot of time with the different video settings but, really, the default ones suit me fine. When I first turned this unit on the Smoothing effect was on high. I've since turned it off because even on low setting videos look like a soap opera. In my neck of the woods I don't get many over-the-air (OTA) channels and have to settle for just a handful of "old people" stations. The internet connection in my building is relatively weak; however, when it does work well, I can stream movies from VUDU in high definition without much interruptions. I plan to keep this piece of electronica around for a few years. I'd originally bought the 49" inch version but, because my vision is not the greatest in the world, returned it for this 55 incher. Amazon refunded my money for the 49" one rather quickly, too. All in all, one of the best purchases I've made in a long time.

Product: TCL 49S517 49-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)

BUT, omg the dirty screen effect is overwhelming! And light leak is pretty bad too, but you won’t notice it unless when ur video is showing majorly white or black scenes.

review_detail.title: Not the best for wall-mounting, giant "wall wart" power cord
review_detail.content: Picture quality is good, even from the sides.  Sound is not bad for a small TV.  I would not buy it again because of 2 things, which may or may not be important to you: 1) The coax and HDMI inputs face directly backwards and are not recessed.  No big deal if you use the stand, but if you wall-mount this TV the inputs are useless unless you buy L-shaped adapters.  And 2) it has a giant "wall wart" power supply instead of a regular power cord.  Way too big to hide/conceal behind a wall-mount bracket.

Product: LG Electronics (22LJ4540) 22-Inch Class Full HD 1080p LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: tyrafenn
review_detail.title: okay picture, nothing to brag about
review_detail.content: Well, ordered this to replace a 5- 6 year old Samsung in my bedroom that finally gave up the ghost after staying on pretty much 24/7 all that time.

Product: LG Electronics (22LJ4540) 22-Inch Class Full HD 1080p LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Donald Chappa
review_detail.title: Great TV at Bargain Price
